title: Junior Systemutvecklare
description:
*Tillsammans med våra kunder skapar vi upplevelser och minnen för livet - och vi gör det för miljontals människor varje år.*

*Vill du vara med och skapa fler upplevelser tillsammans med oss? Vi söker hela tiden efter engagerade kollegor som vill vara med och dela vår resa.*  

  

**Om Tickster**


En gång, för inte allt för länge sedan, var Tickster festivalarrangörernas lilla uppstickarfavorit. Idag har vår plattform utvecklats till att bli Skandinaviens största biljett- och kassasystem med över 6000 arrangörer som väljer Tickster för sin försäljning och evenemangshantering. Vi säljer idag en biljett var 3:e sekund!


#Biljettenärbarabörjan. Försäljning i restauranger, barer och foodtrucks, bordsbokningssystem för dinnershows samt mobila beställningar är bara ett axplock av allt vår plattform hjälper våra kunder med. Vi är stolta över att erbjuda evenemangvärldens mest kompletta system, unikt framtaget för att våra arrangörer ska kunna hantera hela sitt evenemang på ett smidigt och effektivt sätt.


Vi är ett framgångsrikt team med kontor i Arvika och Göteborg, Oslo och Köpenhamn, stolta över vår samarbetskultur, våra kunskaper och erfarenheter – och framför allt vår förmåga att ha roligt tillsammans. Vår drivkraft framåt är att fortsätta expandera i Skandinavien och Europa - vi längtar efter att vara med och skapa upplevelser och minnen för livet hos ännu fler!


Vi söker nu förstärkning till vårt supportteam, med en självgående och driven systemutvecklare som trivs med att vara en nyckelspelare i vårt interna team. Är du redo att ta dig an en utmaning och ta del av Ticksters nya spännande resa? Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss på https://jobs.tickster.com/

 **Om jobbet**


Som utvecklare i vårt supportteam kommer du att arbeta med inkommande ärenden från våra interna kollegor inom Tickster. Du hanterar en varierad mix av supportärenden, från enklare IT-frågor till mer komplexa tekniska problem. Du kommer att identifiera och lösa dessa problem, ofta i nära samarbete med andra avdelningar. Vårt lilla team på idag två personer har ansvar för att skapa och upprätthålla en effektiv supportprocess där mer komplexa ärenden som kräver teknisk utveckling skickas vidare till våra utvecklingsteam.


Vi söker dig som är självgående och tar ansvar för att lösa problem på egen hand, samtidigt som du är en aktiv del av ett team som kontinuerligt arbetar för att förbättra våra processer och stötta kollegor från andra delar av företaget. Vi har liten administrativ overhead och håller möten endast när de tillför värde. Därför får du spendera stor del av dagen i Visual Studio (vi arbetar framförallt med .NET/C#).


Under en typisk arbetsdag kommunicerar du regelbundet med kollegor via Slack eller Meet, diskuterar lösningar och ger feedback på PR:s. Du kan också samarbeta med System Support för att få input om de funktioner du jobbar på, samt använda verktyg som Elk, Jira eller Sentry för att få en bättre förståelse för systemets prestanda och relaterade problem.  

  

**Vi tror och hoppas att du**

  

* Är en ödmjuk lagspelare som vill jobba i ett team med engagerade och drivna kollegor som verkligen gillar det de gör
* Är självgående och har ett driv att lösa problem snabbt och effektivt
* Tycker att mjukvaruutveckling är bland det roligaste som finns
* På riktigt gillar att lära dig nya saker, hela tiden
* Har relevant studieinriktning inom systemutveckling
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta med .NET/C# eller andra relevanta teknologier
* Är med på att kommunikation är viktigt och trivs med att samarbeta med kollegor från andra avdelningar.

**Vi erbjuder dig**

* Ett utvecklande och dynamiskt team där du får vara med och bygga upp och utveckla supportfunktionen
* En möjlighet att arbeta nära andra avdelningar och vara en nyckelspelare i vårt interna arbete
* En arbetsmiljö som värdesätter frihet under ansvar och där vi prioriterar god kommunikation och samarbete
* Stora möjligheter till personlig och professionell utveckling i ett växande företag.


Om du är redo att ta dig an en spännande utmaning och ingå i ett roligt sammanhang, är du varmt välkommen att skicka in din ansökan senast den 7 december. Vi tar emot ansökningar löpande och då tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag vill vi gärna ha din ansökan så snart som möjligt.

title: Game developer
description:
We are now looking for the best game developer to join us! You have the chance to be a part of creating the best casino games in the online slot industry!
   

  

**Job Description**
* Design, develop and maintain Casino Games for both desktop and mobile browsers
* The technologies you primarily will work with are HTML5, WebGL, Typescript, Pixi, GSAP and Javascript.
* In a team environment that consists of product management, graphic artistry, sound creation, server development and game mechanics, you will contribute to deliver the best casino games in the market today.
* Your main responsibilities are to make the game graphics come alive with spectacular animations, game flow, game mechanics and sounds according to a result delivered by our game servers.


 Who you are
   

  

* You are a Master Google Searcher that have Stackoverflow as your absolute favourite web site.
* You have practical experience of working with OOP in some language and you have a pragmatic approach to software development.
* Taking on technical challenges and solving them is something you take pride in.
* Quality, not only of the code you write, but the delivered system is important to you.
* You thrive in an environment where you are responsible for your code and take ownership of changes from editor to production system.


 Beneficial skills
   

  

* Working experience of mobile browsers and knowledge about their limitations and how they work in different ways is a big plus.


 Who we are
   

  

 We are the best and fastest growing slot provider in the world with the operator and product in focus, and the mobile future on our minds. Nolimit is a team of experienced professionals from the gambling industry in Stockholm, Sweden, Malta and Gurugram, India. Our company has derived from hands on work at some of the most successful gambling software providers and operators over the last 15 years. Our mission is to offer a fast, reliable and flexible team that cooperates with the best operators in the world, taking gambling to the next level.
   

  

 We have a clean code high performance modern mini/micro service portable system platform for mobile and desktop that is 100 % under our own control. Since we have our own platform, this allows us to deliver special features and smooth, customizable marketing campaigns that are tailored to the operator's specific needs. We think it's time for a new angle to the gambling software industry – one where the product is in focus and we fully engage their promotion, marketing and country manager system/activities with our games. Nolimit work with customers on a global scale and the largest gambling operators in the world have our games everywhere.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Frontend Developer
description:
**NOTE - Fluent Swedish is a hard requirement!** 




  





**Frontend Developers - Stockholm** 




  





**About:** 




 CodeX Digital are partnered with a very exciting Stockholm based start-up who are on a mission to revolutionise a traditional out-dated industry!
 



  





 We're after skilled Frontend Engineers who are proficient in React/TypeScript to come in and build new features/products, maintain frontend applications & collaborate with product and engineering teams in a fast paced, product driven environment.
 



  





**The Role:** 



* Build key frontend applications using React/TypeScript
* Collaborate closely with product and other teams to deliver new features
* Take ownership and lead smaller projects
* Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code



  





**Tech Stack:** 




 React | TypeScript | JavaScript | RESTful APIs
 



  





**What we’re looking for:** 



* Minimum 5 years’ experience in frontend development with React
* Ideally degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or similar
* Proactive and collaborative mindset
* Fluent in Swedish



  





 Role is based in Stockholm & we can offer a hybrid working policy.

title: Backend Developer
description:
**About Froda** 




  





 Froda was founded in 2015 with a clear vision – to revolutionize the banking experience for entrepreneurs by making it easy and affordable to invest in their ideas. Today, we are one of Sweden's fastest-growing fintech companies with large international growth plans. We are a creative tech company with the ambition to turn a historically expensive and unfair industry into something ethical and sustainable by promoting entrepreneurship.
 



  





 Our mission to revolutionize the banking experience for entrepreneurs is not only reflected in our products but also in our workplace. By fostering a culture of respect, collaboration, and continuous learning, we provide opportunities for personal growth and professional development. Join us in transforming the banking industry and be a part of our journey to empower entrepreneurs.
 



  





**About The Role** 




  





 To further develop and scale our tech platform, enabling us to continue improving the banking experience for entrepreneurs, we are expanding our tech department. As a Backend Developer at Froda, you will be part of a cross-functional team working in one of our product areas — either developing features for our partners, improving our credit systems or maintaining our loan and payments core. For each team, the idea is to continuously deliver customer value as well as to improve the technical structure to make sure our systems are stable and healthy. Together with your team, you will design, build, and deliver scalable and maintainable solutions that directly impact our customers.
 



  





 You will get a unique chance to be a part of a scaling fintech company with strong momentum and a stable foundation, backed by a banking license as a quality stamp.
 



  





**Who are you?** 




  





 We believe that you are an experienced and curious developer who thrives in collaborative environments and is passionate about building scalable solutions with real impact. You enjoy working closely with other skilled and open-minded professionals and actively contribute to knowledge sharing and continuous improvement. You are a pragmatic problem solver who communicates clearly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. You are fluent in both English and Swedish.
 



  





 We believe that you have experience of:
 



  




* At least 4 years in a similar role, ideally within product-focused teams
* Programming in C#/.NET with a solid understanding of modern software design principles
* Working with SQL and NoSQL databases in production environments
* Cloud platforms such as Azure (or other major providers)
* Agile methodologies and best practices in software engineering, including testing, CI/CD, and DevOps mindset
* Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, RabbitMQ, and microservices architecture is a strong plus



  





**What’s in it for you?** 




  





 At Froda, you’ll be part of a company that combines the best of both worlds – a fast-moving, high-energy culture with the stability and structure to support long-term success. We’re 100+ ambitious self-starters who genuinely care for each other and the work we do, all while having fun together.
 



  





 Here, you’ll have the opportunity to take ownership of your work, develop your skills, and shape your own growth journey. With big ambitions and a rapidly evolving business, there’s plenty of room to grow, lead initiatives, and make a real impact on both our company and the industry. If you're looking to be part of a success story and contribute to something bigger, this is the place for you.
 



  





 Furthermore, you’ll get:
 



  




* An opportunity to be part of an exciting journey, shaping the future of our company and transforming the SME financing landscape
* Fabulous office overlooking Stockholm and a friendly culture that values work/life balance
* We prioritize working in the office to maximize the positive impact of in-person collaboration, but we offer flexibility with work hours and remote work
* Competitive compensation package
* Insurance and pension plan



  





 This role is all about building the tech that powers funding for thousands of entrepreneurs —if you're excited by our mission, apply or tell a friend!

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
**English Speaking** 




  





**Full-Stack JavaScript Developer** 




 We’re building a next-generation customer management platform used by tens of thousands worldwide. Our product helps modern businesses put their customers at the center, managing workflows, insights, and automation at scale. As a Full-Stack JavaScript Developer, you’ll join a global engineering team shaping one of the most critical systems for today’s enterprises.
 



  





**Must-haves** 



* Strong experience with JavaScript/TypeScript
* Proficiency in VueJS (or similar frameworks) and NodeJS
* Solid knowledge of APIs, microservices, and databases (MongoDB or similar)
* Experience writing clean, scalable, maintainable code
* Ability to collaborate in a distributed, remote team environment



  





**Nice-to-haves** 



* Experience with GCP, BigQuery, Firebase, or other cloud platforms
* Knowledge of Tailwind CSS, Storybook, or state management tools (Pinia/Vuex)
* Familiarity with queues (PubSub) and cloud functions
* Background in building customer-facing SaaS products

title: Software Developer
description:
**Are you a passionate Software Developer looking for your next big challenge?** 
 Do you enjoy solving complex problems, building scalable applications, and working with a team that values innovation and collaboration?
   

  

 My name is Nina Fogelberg and I work as Head of B2B Products & Platforms at Telia Finance. I’m now looking to expand the team with a Software Developer to our Final team in Telia Finance AB. The new Transformation team is established to work with our new Final Java platform that will be in production in early 2026. Are you the one we’re looking for?
   

  

**Is this you next opportunity?**
 Final is our Telia Finance core platform supporting our B2B business products Leasing and Billing. As a Software Developer you will be responsible for develop/re-write integrations, develop functions according to our new design philosophy and be part of the modernization of the migrated platform. Our new design will replace functions that are not part of the one-to-one migration of the platform. We are in the transformation journey of migrating the current Cobol based platform to Java, in this work we also need to transform integrations and file flows so that these can communicate with the new Java based platform.
   

  

 Key responsibilities:
   

  

* Manage coding and code reviews to maintain high code quality standards
* Database integration, particularly with Oracle RDBMS
* Work in Kubernetes-based Linux environments, including Bash scriptning
* Perform tests and documentation
* Frontend development using React or Vue, JavaScript, TypeScript, and CSS


**Is this you?**
 To be successful in this role we believe you have at least 7 years of backend development experience in Java, and are comfortable with management tools like Maven, as well as Kubernetes-based Linux environments. You have previously been working with modern version control and CI/CD tools such as GitHub, GitHub Runners, and JFrog Artifactory. A solid understanding of test-driven development (TDD) is essential. Fluency in English is required, fluency in Swedish is preferred.
   

  

**Key experience:**
* Hands-on coding and code reviews to maintain high code quality standards
* Experience with build and dependency management tools, such as Maven
* Working in Kubernetes-based Linux environments, including Bash scripting
* Version control and CI/CD tools, including GitHub, GitHub Runners, and JFrog Artifactory
* Familiarity with test-driven development (TDD)
* Fluency in English, fluency in Swedish is preferred.
* Experience with advanced invoicing solutions, accounts receivable systems, or accounting functionality within a business system context is considered a plus


**It’s more than just a job**
 At Telia Finance, we will give you the tools and support you need to grow both professionally and personally. We can offer you your next big opportunity in a creative, motivating, and welcoming company where everyone can be themselves, with equal access to opportunities. In addition to an attractive and inclusive work environment, we also enable flexibility and offer a wide variety of employee benefits. We offer flexible working conditions that support collaboration and growth, with most of your time spent at our modern office to foster teamwork and innovation.
   

  

 Here at Telia Finance we deeply value personal development; for example, we offer internal training to all employees as a way of helping our employees in their personal and professional growth. We welcome applicants with different backgrounds and nationalities, but we do require you to have the relevant work permits for Sweden. We offer you a flexible working environments,
   

  

**Interested?**
 If this sounds like the right opportunity for you, we would love to hear from you! For more information, feel free to contact Talent Partner Christine Wilén, at christine.wilen@teliacompany.com. Location for this position is Solna, Stockholm.
   

  

 To ensure your personal data is handled securely, please apply through our recruitment system. We are unable to accept applications via email. The selection process is ongoing, and the position may be filled before the deadline. During the process, required background controls will be performed.
   

  

**Welcome to Telia Finance – Home to you next big opportunity!**

title: Back End Developer
description:

 We’re looking for a talented Backend Developer who enjoys solving complex challenges, writing clean, efficient code, and paying close attention to detail. You’ll play a key role in building and maintaining reliable software that powers our products and enhances the experience for our users.

title: Senior Dotnet Developer
description:
We're working with a fast-growing, product-focused tech company based in Stockholm that is looking to hire a Senior .NET Developer. This is a hybrid role, requiring a few days per week in their central Stockholm office. The team builds scalable backend systems that support a high-traffic, global user base, and they're looking for someone with a strong technical foundation who can contribute to long-term architectural decisions while remaining hands-on in daily development. All communication is in English, and the working environment is highly international.
 



  





**Requirements:** 



* 6+ years of professional experience with .NET (C#, .NET Core/.NET 6+)
* Solid experience building and maintaining APIs and microservices
* Strong knowledge of SQL and relational databases such as PostgreSQL or SQL Server
* Hands-on experience with cloud platforms, ideally Azure
* Familiarity with DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and version control (Git)
* Comfortable working in a hybrid model with 2–3 days onsite in Stockholm
* Excellent communication skills in English



  





**Nice to have:** 



* Experience working in a product-led or consumer-facing company
* Familiarity with Docker, Kubernetes, or other containerisation technologies
* Interest or background in telecoms, mobile services, or payments

title: Software Engineer
description:
Sinch is a global customer engagement platform that provides communication services for businesses across messaging, voice, and email. Sinch's services are used by more than 150,000 businesses, including many of the world's largest tech companies.
 



**ABOUT SINCH** 




 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses - including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others - rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
 



 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
 



 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
 



**DESCRIPTION** 




 We are looking for a versatile Software Engineer to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will work closely with engineers, product managers, and stakeholders to design, develop, maintain, and support high-quality, scalable software solutions to meet customer needs.
 



 You will be an integral part of a collaborative team that embraces agile methodologies and values clean coding practices. Creativity and innovation are key, and we believe that every team member's input is vital for delivering exceptional communication solutions.
 



 This hybrid role based in Stockholm and reports to the Senior Engineering Manager.
 



**As our Software Engineer, you will:** 



* Design, develop, test, and maintain software applications and systems.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
* Troubleshoot and debug applications to optimize performance and enhance user experience.
* Contribute to all phases of the development lifecycle, from concept to implementation.
* Ensure performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* Proven experience as a Software Engineer.
* Good understanding of software development methodologies (Agile, Scrum, etc.).
* Strong proficiency in Java programming languages.
* Experience of REST APIs.
* Knowledge of Kubernetes, cloud technologies, CI/CD, automation, and pipelines.
* Experience in Apache Kafka.
* Familiarity with version control systems, such as Git.



**REQUIREMENTS** 




 You are a problem-solver with keen attention to detail, strong communication skills, and a proven ability to collaborate effectively in team environments. We believe you are strong in Java but also willing to accept not to program in Java if that is the current need. You learn new domains quickly and are willing to take on and complete assignments in new areas as needed. You are creative and think outside the box but also understand when there is a need to stay within the box when reality so demands.
 



 Our corporate language is English, please submit your application in
 **English.** 




 At Sinch, we value learning, embrace change, and offer opportunities for personal and professional growth. Unfortunately, we are not supporting relocation at this time.
 



 Applicants must:
 


* Hold Swedish or EU/EEA citizenship.
* Have a valid Swedish work permit.



**OUR HIRING PROCESS** 




 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
 



 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Vision Software Engineer
description:
**DeLaval Is Looking For a Experienced Computer Vision Engineer**
 There are lots of opportunities for smart vision applications on a modern dairy farm. Today we supervise the condition of the cows and even control robots in real-time via vision. Tomorrow, we plan to do even more. Clever vision solutions will help farmers around the world to run their operations in a more efficient and environmentally friendly way.
   

  

 We are now looking for an experienced Computer Vision Engineer for our Data Science & Vision Team. This is a job where you clearly can see how your code will help the end customer every day. A trip to a farm now and then will also give you a better understanding of the environment and the problems we have to solve.
   

  

**Main Tasks**
* Develop and maintain computer vision applications for the dairy industry
* Take part in Proof-of-Concept studies and innovation projects
* Evaluate new technologies and tools in the area of computer vision
* Continuously develop and refine our way of working with vision technology


**Qualifications**
* Master’s degree in Engineering Physics, Computer Science or similar
* Experience from working with product development in industrial companies
* C++ and OpenCV
* Computer Vision experience – preferrable both traditional- and model-based image processing
* Knowledge about cameras, optics and illumination for computer vision
* Embedded system experience is a plus
* Experience from robotic applications is a plus
* Embedded systems experience is a plus
* Ability to communicate in Swedish


**Personal Competences**
* Collaborative mind-set
* Ability to excel in an agile small team environment
* Curiosity and out-of-the-box thinking
* Not afraid of getting hands dirty on a dairy farm from time to time


**We offer you**
 An opportunity to work with vision applications in a creative and dedicated team with end-to-end responsibility.
   

  

 An exciting position at the forefront of technology in a market leading company with customers all over the world.
   

  

 A possibility to work with software development and vision technology in a different and fun area of application, where you solve real world problems and clearly can see the result of your work.
   

  

 The position will be located in Tumba, Stockholm, and reports to Björn Wiklander, Manager Data Science & Vision Technology. The job may occasionally require some travel to test farms, in Sweden and abroad.
   

  

 Welcome with your application (in English)! We will review applications continuously. The last day to apply is December 20.
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.
   

  

 Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group. See more at www.delavalcorporate.com .

title: Staff Engineer, Feature Engineering Platform
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a Staff Engineer to join the ML Platform organization and lead the design and evolution of our Feature Engineering Platform. This team owns the foundational layer that connects data and ML workflows, and is central to our mission of making machine learning development seamless, accessible, and production-ready across the company.
   

  

 As a Staff Engineer, you’ll shape the architecture and vision of a platform that enables users — from analysts to applied scientists — to explore, engineer, and deploy features with confidence and speed. You’ll work at the intersection of data infrastructure, developer experience, and ML operations, building systems that abstract complexity while ensuring scale, reliability, and strong user ergonomics.
   

  

 What you’ll be doing
   

  

* Design and drive the architecture for a unified feature engineering experience across batch, streaming, and online contexts.
* Partner closely with UX, product-minded engineers, and ML practitioners to craft high-leverage abstractions.
* Lead cross-cutting initiatives spanning dev environments, notebook integrations, data orchestration, and serving pipelines.
* Embed platform reliability, observability, and data quality into the development lifecycle by default.
* Mentor and uplift a team of engineers across different levels and domains.


 Our humble expectations\*
   

  

* Proven experience designing and scaling complex software, data or, ML platforms.
* Experience in production ML, feature stores, high scalable services.
* Deep expertise in backend systems, APIs, and orchestration — bonus for exposure to Spark, Flink, or streaming data stacks.
* Previous experience in Golang (or compile languages) and Python.
* Track record of shaping developer-facing interfaces or platforms with attention to usability and iteration speed.
* Comfort leading technical strategy and aligning cross-team efforts.


 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Cloud developer
description:
Scania's R&D department is transforming to become part of TRATON Group R&D. TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 We are looking for a Cloud Developer to join our development team within the Departure Management area. This includes remote- heating, cooling and schedule charging for BEV and ICE. Our team is responsible for the backend solution enabling connected functions in the vehicle all the way to the cloud.
   

  

 You will be part of shaping a robust, scalable, and cost-effective cloud platform that supports connected services across all TRATON brands.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll work closely with skilled developers and engineers in a fast-paced environment focused on high performance, reliability, and innovation.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain cloud-native services using Python.
* Design serverless infrastructure on AWS using constructs such as Lambdas, DynamoDB, API Gateway, etc.
* Build and operate CI/CD pipelines for automated deployments.
* Ensure high performance, reliability, and cost-efficiency in cloud infrastructure across all TRATON brands.


**Who You Are**
* You are a proficient software developer with strong coding skills in Python.
* You have solid experience with AWS services and are comfortable working with serverless systems and storage solutions.
* You are a collaborative and communicative team player, with excellent English skills and a proactive mindset.
* You are curious about cloud integration and how in-vehicle software can connect to scalable backends.
* You take pride in delivering high-quality, reliable solutions.
* You are motivated by the impact of BEVs on sustainability and want to contribute to the electrified transport revolution.


 We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – your unique experience and perspectives is valuable to us.
   

  

**This us us**
 We’re a tight-knit, high-performing, small team, working according to agile principles. While delivery is always in focus, innovation and personal growth are never compromised.
   

  

 We combine embedded expertise with cloud capabilities to deliver safe, secure, and efficient charging solutions for BEV customers and departure management.
   

  

 Everyone takes ownership – and has each other’s back. We value trust, collaboration, and the freedom to explore and improve.
   

  

 Together with the other teams in our group, we form a key capability in the future of connected and electrified transport solutions.
   

  

 Within TRATON Group R&D, you are an important part of something bigger. Joining us means gaining access to the ins and outs of the entire transportation industry. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Being bigger also means being stronger. Together with our brands, we have the collective power to transform transportation.
   

  

**We offer**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON Group R&D supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include wellness allowance, TRATON result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. We also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-11-27. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Sofie Jalonen, Head of Connected Streaming Data, sofie.jalonen@scania.com.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Embedded developer and tester
description:
Scania's R&D department is transforming to become part of TRATON Group R&D. TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 We are looking for a skilled Embedded Developer and Tester to join our development team within the Departure Management area. This includes remote- heating, cooling and schedule charging for BEV and ICE. Our team is responsible for the backend solution enabling connected functions in the vehicle all the way to the cloud.
   

  

 You will play a key role in developing secure, adaptive, and cloud-connected embedded systems that enable advanced charging strategies in the TRATON brands – driving both customer value and sustainability.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll work hands-on with cutting-edge platforms such as Adaptive AUTOSAR and QNX, and contribute to the bridge between in-vehicle ECUs and the AWS cloud. You will collaborate closely with developers and engineers in a fast-paced environment focused on high performance, safety, and innovation.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Design, develop, and test embedded software components using C++ in an Adaptive AUTOSAR environment.
* Work on a QNX-based communication ECU, including inter-process communication, resource management, and integration with vehicle networks (CAN, SOME/IP, Ethernet).
* Contribute to the secure connection between embedded systems and AWS IoT services.
* Ensure robust testing and continuous integration for both embedded and cloud-linked systems.
* Collaborate in cross-functional Agile teams and contribute to continuous improvement of development and test processes.


**Who You Are**
* You have solid experience in embedded software development, particularly with C++ and preferably with Adaptive AUTOSAR in automotive environments.
* You’re comfortable working with QNX and automotive communication protocols such as CAN, SOME/IP, and Ethernet.
* You are curious about cloud integration and how in-vehicle software can connect to scalable backends.
* You are a collaborative and communicative team player, with excellent English skills and a proactive mindset.
* You take pride in delivering high-quality, reliable solutions.
* You are motivated by the impact of BEVs on sustainability and want to contribute to the electrified transport revolution.
* A truck driver’s license (C/CE) is considered a strong plus.


 We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – your unique experience and perspectives is valuable to us.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 We’re a tight-knit, high-performing team of four developers, working according to value-based SAFe agile principles. While delivery is always in focus, innovation and personal growth are never compromised.
   

  

 We combine embedded expertise with cloud capabilities to deliver safe, secure, and efficient charging solutions for BEV customers and departure management.
   

  

 Everyone takes ownership – and has each other’s back. We value trust, collaboration, and the freedom to explore and improve.
   

  

 Together with the other teams in our group, we form a key capability in the future of connected and electrified transport solutions.
   

  

 Within TRATON Group R&D, you are an important part of something bigger. Joining us means gaining access to the ins and outs of the entire transportation industry. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Being bigger also means being stronger. Together with our brands, we have the collective power to transform transportation.
   

  

**We Offer**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON Group R&D supports your career growth both locally and internationally. Benefits include wellness allowance, TRATON result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. We also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-11-27. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: Sofie Jalonen, Head of Connected Streaming Data SWE, sofie.jalonen@scania.com
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: ServiceNow Developer- ITOM modules, especially Event Management and Operational Intelligence.
description:
**ServiceNow Developer- ITOM modules, especially Event Management and Operational Intelligence.** 




  





 My client is looking for
 **ServiceNow Developer** 
 , and I wanted to know whether this would be of interest to you or not?
 



  





**Position: ServiceNow Developer** 




**Location: Stockholm, Sweden (Hybrid)** 




**Duration: 6+ months contract** 




  





 Role Description:
 



 Design & Development E2E: Configure and customize ServiceNow ITOM modules, especially Event Management and Operational Intelligence.
 



 Develop and maintain integrations with third-party monitoring tools and IT systems.
 



 Implement CI correlation to ensure accurate mapping and relationships in CMDB
 



 As a ServiceNow Developer specializing in Event Management, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining ServiceNow ITOM solutions, particularly focusing on Event Management and CMDB modules.
 



 You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration, monitoring, and automation of IT infrastructure events.
 



 Maintenance & Support: Perform routine maintenance tasks including patching, upgrades, and performance tuning.
 



 Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to Event Management implementations.
 



  





 Required Skills
 



 5+ years of ServiceNow development hands on experience.
 



 Strong hands-on experience with Event Management and/or CMDB modules.

 Experience with ServiceNow scripting (Business Rules, Client Scripts, UI Policies, etc.).
