title: It-chef
description:
Vill du vara med och utveckla vår it-verksamhet och digitalisering? Nu söker vi en erfaren och utvecklingsinriktad it-chef till vår it-enhet.
 



  





 Som it-chef får du en viktig och strategisk roll i myndigheten med ansvar för att leda, utveckla och säkerställa en robust och verksamhetsanpassad it-miljö. Du är tillika enhetschef med verksamhet-, personal- och budgetansvar. Inom enheten ligger också ansvaret för informationssäkerhet.
 



  





 Enheten ingår i avdelningen för verksamhetsstöd och juridik. På avdelningen finns även HR-enheten, ekonomi- och verksamhetsstyrning, rättsenheten, enheten för säkerhet och lokalförvaltning samt kansliet för Skolväsendets överklagandenämnd.
 



  





 It-chefen rapporterar till avdelningschefen och ingår i avdelningens ledningsgrupp.
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter och ansvarsområden** 




  





 Som it-chef driver du tillsammans med dina medarbetare digitaliseringsfrågor, utveckling och förvaltning så att vårt it-stöd möter verksamhetens behov på ett säkert, effektivt och framtidssäkrat sätt. Du arbetar strategiskt men har även kunskap och förmåga att driva verksamheten operativt.
 



  





 Du bygger en stabil, kostnadseffektiv it-funktion med tydlig styrning av it-utvecklingen samt en trygg systemförvaltning. Myndigheten har avtal med en extern driftleverantör som förvaltar och driftar myndighetens applikationer vilket kräver en kompetent beställarorganisation. På enheten finns även ansvaret för att samordna och driva informationssäkerhetsfrågorna i myndigheten.
 



  





  





**Kvalifikationer** 




  





 Du har:
 


* Universitetsexamen som myndigheten bedömer som relevant för uppdraget eller motsvarande kunskap inhämtad genom arbetslivserfarenhet som Skolinspektionen bedömer likvärdig
* Flerårig erfarenhet av att vara it-chef inom offentlig förvaltning eller motsvarande roll som Skolinspektionen bedömer likvärdig
* Flerårig erfarenhet som chef med verksamhets-, personal och budgetansvar
* Aktuell kunskap och erfarenhet inom it och informationssäkerhet
* Erfarenhet av beställarroll och kravställning gentemot externa leverantörer
* Mycket god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska



  





**Det är meriterande att ha:** 



* Erfarenhet från projektledning inom it-området
* Erfarenhet av förändringsledning
* Arbetslivserfarenhet från statlig myndighet
* Erfarenhet av upphandling enligt lagen om offentlig upphandling (LOU)



  





 För att trivas på Skolinspektionen ska du tycka om att arbeta i en verksamhet med högt tempo, varierade arbetsuppgifter och en arbetsmiljö där kollegor har hög kompetens och breda erfarenheter. För att bedöma om en sökande kommer att lyckas i tjänsten som it-chef kommer vi att lägga stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper samt vid ledaregenskaper.
 



  





 Vi söker dig som:
 


* är en utvecklingsinriktad ledare med god samarbetsförmåga som har lätt för att skapa relationer inom och utanför organisationen
* skapar engagemang, delaktighet och som bidrar till ett öppet klimat
* är analytisk, strategisk, har lätt att se helhetsbilden och som snabbt kan sätta dig in i olika situationer
* är kommunikativ och tydlig, uttrycker dig välformulerat i text och tal och har en pedagogisk förmåga att göra komplexa frågeställningar begripliga
* är strukturerad, stabil och har hög integritet



  





**Tjänsten** 




 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning. Skolinspektionen tillämpar sex månaders provanställning. Omfattningen är heltid. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.
 



 Skolinspektionen värnar om att vara en arbetsplats som är fri från diskriminering och ger lika möjligheter för alla.
 



  





**Är du intresserad?** 




 Välkommen med din ansökan, senast den 8 december 2025. Sök direkt via
 **Easy Apply** 
 här på LinkedIn. Vid frågor kontakta rekryteringskonsult Carina Eyoma,
 **carina.eyoma@se.experis.com** 
 , 073-086 22 75 på Experis IT.
 



  





 Intervjuer kommer ske löpande. Bakgrundskontroller kommer genomföras som ett led i rekryteringsprocessen
 



  





*I denna rekrytering har Skolinspektionen redan tagit ställning till önskvärda rekryteringskanaler och marknadsföring. Vi undanber oss därför vänligt men bestämt samtal från annonsförmedlare eller försäljare.*

title: Vi söker en Kravledare – Var med och forma framtidens maritima IT-lösningar!
description:
**Är du en strukturerad och kommunikativ person som brinner för att förstå verksamhetens behov och översätta dem till tekniska lösningar? Då kan du vara vår nästa Kravledare!**
**Om tjänsten** 
 Vi söker en Kravledare som vill vara med och forma framtidens maritima digitala lösningar. Du kommer att ha en nyckelroll i att översätta verksamhetens behov till tydliga, realiserbara krav som utvecklingsteamen kan arbeta med.
   

  

**Dina ansvarsområden
   

  

 –** 
 Leda kravhantering i IT-projekt – från behovsanalys till färdig lösning
   

  

 – Hålla i workshops och intervjuer med verksamheten för att fånga in krav
   

  

 – Strukturera, dokumentera och prioritera krav i nära dialog med produktägare och utvecklingsteam
   

  

 – Utforma kravspecifikationer (funktionella och icke-funktionella krav)
   

  

 – Säkerställa att krav är spårbara, testbara och uppfyller verksamhetens mål
   

  

 – Delta i lösningsdiskussioner och bidra till att tekniska lösningar uppfyller både affärs- och användarkrav
   

  

 – Stödja utvecklingsteamet under hela utvecklingscykeln
   

  

 – Bidra till förbättring av processer och metoder inom kravhantering
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

 –** 
 Minst 5 års erfarenhet som Kravledare inom IT och systemutvecklingsprojekt
   

  

 – God förståelse för systemutvecklingsprocesser – både agilt (Scrum, SAFe) och traditionellt
   

  

 – Erfarenhet av verktyg som Jira, Confluence, Azure DevOps eller liknande
   

  

 – Förmåga att kommunicera effektivt med både systemutvecklare och verksamhet
   

  

 – Strukturerat arbetssätt och vana att driva workshops och dialoger med många intressenter
   

  

 – Mycket god kommunikationsförmåga och förmåga att ställa rätt frågor
   

  

 – God svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
   

  

**Meriterande:
   

  

 –** 
 Certifiering inom kravhantering (ex. IREB, CPRE, CBAP)
   

  

 – Tidigare erfarenhet av arbete med komplexa IT-arkitekturer eller integrationer
   

  

 – Bakgrund inom systemutveckling, test eller projektledning
   

  

**Vi erbjuder:
   

  

 –** 
 Ett stimulerande arbete med stor variation
   

  

 – Möjlighet att påverka lösningar och arbeta nära beslutsfattare
   

  

 – Kompetensutveckling och möjlighet till certifieringar
   

  

 – Hybridarbete, vi värdesätter balans mellan arbete och fritid
   

  

 – Kollektivavtal
   

  

**Kontakt:**
 Har du några frågor eller funderingar är du välkommen att kontakta Therés Hesselgren Zaar på thz@softronic.se
   

  

 Vi har valt media, säljsamtal undanbedes.

title: Head of Cyber Defence
description:
**Job Description**

 H&M Group is transforming the way it addresses the continuously evolving and complex cyber security threats and risks. To do this we have a Tech Centre focused solely on managing Cyber Security for all our brands and majority investments.
   

  





 Within this Cyber Security Tech Centre, we have a Cyber Defence Center (CDC) that is a key security function at H&M Group, which aims to detect and respond to threats to our data or technology systems, 24 x 7. The CDC has 3 teams located both in Stockholm and India, and consists of Cyber Defence Analysts, Attack Surface Reduction Analyst and Cyber Defence Engineers. The CDC also leverages the best-in-class security technology and security providers.
   

  





 This role reports to the Chief Technology Risk Information Officer (CISO).
   

  





**Responsibilities:**



* Lead and manage the Cyber Defence Center, ensuring effective coordination and collaboration among cyber defence teams.
* Develop and implement comprehensive cyber security strategies to protect the organization's digital assets.
* Provide leadership and technical guidance to managers of cyber defence teams, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation.
* Enable strong organizational health by making sure that your employees prioritize both deliveries as well as own competence development.
* Oversee the identification, assessment, and mitigation of cyber threats and vulnerabilities.
* Ensure compliance with relevant cyber security regulations and standards.
* Own and manage the cyber incident response and recovery processes, including coordination with stakeholders.
* Monitor and analyze cyber security trends and emerging threats to proactively address potential risks.
* Collaborate with other departments to integrate cyber security measures into business processes and initiatives.
* Prepare and present regular reports on the status of cyber security initiatives to senior management.
* Manage the units’ budget and monitor its financial effectiveness.
* Formal staff responsibility, including salary review, performance dialogues and support in individual development plans and competence needs.
* Contribute operationally, where necessary.


**Qualifications**
* Minimum of 10 years of experience in cyber security, with at least 5 years in a leadership role.
* Proven track record of managing and leading cyber defense teams.
* In-depth knowledge of cyber security frameworks, standards, and best practices.
* Strong understanding and a hands-on approach to threat intelligence, risk management, and incident response.
* Strong communication experience with demonstrated ability to influence people, even at senior levels, and ability to communicate in a timely and clear way
* Ability to coach others in a way that enables them to grow professionally and to increase their performance
* Experience setting and handling resource allocation budget.
* Experience with handling difficult situations both in uncertain circumstances as well as in employee related matters.
* Good at balancing striving for speed, reducing complexity, and focusing on the outcome
* Experience in managing complex cyber security projects and initiatives in a global scale
* Exceptional leadership skills, with the ability to develop and grow your colleagues in complex environments.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to work under pressure and handle multiple priorities.
* Relevant certifications such as CISSP, CISM, or equivalent.


**Additional Information**

 This is a fulltime permanent position. The role is
 **based in our office in London or Stockholm.**
  

 Apply by sending in your
 **CV in English** 
 as soon as possible. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through career page.
   

  





**Benefits**




 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  





 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  





**Inclusion & Diversity**




 At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  





 We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.
   

  





**Company Description**




 H&M Group is a family of brands; H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET and Afound. At H&M Group, our people are the driving force behind our commitment to creating meaningful growth and more sustainable lifestyles. Help us re-imagine fashion and together we will re-shape our industry. Learn more about H&M Group here.

title: Network Engineer
description:
**Job Description** 




**Position Overview:** 




 We are seeking an experienced Network Engineer specializing in
 **WLAN, LAN, and Data Center (DC)** 
 network infrastructure. The candidate will be responsible for designing, implementing, and managing enterprise-level network solutions to ensure high availability, security, and optimal performance across all network layers.
 



**Roles and Responsibilities:** 




**Network Design & Implementation** 



* Design, deploy, and maintain
 **LAN, WLAN, and Data Center** 
 networks across multiple sites.
* Configure and manage networking devices including
 **switches, routers, wireless controllers, firewalls, and load balancers** 
 .
* Evaluate and implement network architectures following industry standards and security best practices.



**Operations & Support** 



* Monitor network performance and troubleshoot issues to ensure minimal downtime.
* Perform root cause analysis and provide permanent solutions for recurring incidents.
* Manage network capacity, performance tuning, and optimization.



**Security & Compliance** 



* Implement network security policies and controls including NAC, authentication, encryption, and segmentation.
* Ensure compliance with organizational IT security standards and regulatory requirements.



**Documentation & Reporting** 



* Maintain up-to-date network diagrams, standard operating procedures, and configuration documentation.
* Prepare reports on network utilization, incidents, and performance metrics.



**Collaboration & Stakeholder Management** 



* Work closely with infrastructure, cloud, and security teams to support business initiatives.
* Act as a technical escalation point for network-related projects and issues.



**Required Skills & Experience:** 



* **8+ years** 
 of hands-on experience in
 **LAN, WLAN, and Data Center network operations and design** 
 .
* Strong knowledge of
 **Cisco, Aruba, Juniper, or equivalent vendor technologies** 
 .
* Experience with
 **Wireless controllers, Access points, VLANs, STP, BGP, OSPF, QoS, VXLAN, SDN, and DC switching** 
 .
* Understanding of
 **Network security tools** 
 (Firewalls, ACLs, VPNs, RADIUS, TACACS).
* Familiarity with
 **ITIL framework and ticketing tools** 
 .
* Experience in multi-vendor environments.



**Preferred Qualifications:** 



* Cisco certifications (
 **CCNA / CCNP / CCIE** 
 ) or equivalent.
* Experience with
 **SD-WAN, SD-Access, or Network Automation** 
 .
* Experience in large enterprise or service provider networks.



**Soft Skills:** 



* Excellent communication and stakeholder management.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
* Ability to work independently and in cross-functional teams.

title: (Senior) IT Analyst
description:
**Join us to deliver a smoke-free future as (Senior) IT Analyst!**
 We’ve chosen to do something incredible. We’re totally transforming our business and building our future with one clear purpose – to deliver a smoke-free future. Swedish Match is an affiliate of PMI and has been a leader in the industry for more than 200 years
   

  

 In the Nordic region, we are 1,600 employees based in Sweden, Denmark, Finland, and Norway working in various functions and teams, and together we are collaborating to deliver a smoke-free Nordics
   

  

*Context*
**Responsibilities**
 The mission of the Nordics IT team is to deploy and maintain the technology that is critical for the success of our company’s mission in the Nordic markets. The main responsibilities of the team are:
   

  

* Implement technology solutions to facilitate an omnichannel consumer experience and resolve challenges throughout the consumer journey, maintaining compliance with diverse regulatory requirements across our product offerings.
* Deliver B2B technology to optimally engage with trade partners, with full consideration of architectural requirements and alignment to the larger strategic landscape.
* Support and continuously enhance all Nordic solutions, delivering a high rate of improvements across the entire landscape, while keeping a clear focus on the broader strategy and roadmap.
* For each initiative and application, assess at a high level of architectural detail, ensuring solutions fit within our overall strategy and technology roadmap.


 To strengthen this team, we are looking for an IT ANALYST. Are you the person we are looking for?
   

  

 If so, then please continue reading.
   

  

 As an IT Analyst within the Nordics IT team, you will play a key role in enabling our mission to deploy and maintain critical technology for PMI’s success in the Nordic markets. You will collaborate closely with local process owners to understand and define business requirements, translating them into effective functional flows, user experience designs, and standards that support seamless omnichannel consumer and B2B experiences while ensuring compliance and architectural alignment. Your responsibilities will span the planning, design, and implementation of IT solutions, continuous enhancement of Nordic applications, and coordination of security measures to safeguard information. Success in this role requires strong communication and change management skills to balance stakeholder expectations, resolve conflicting priorities, and drive improvements that align with our broader strategy and technology roadmap.
   

  

**You Day-to-day**
* Drive Business Alignment and platform rollouts
* Partner with stakeholders to capture requirements and align solutions with business objectives.
* Lead localisation and integration efforts for global platforms, ensuring seamless adoption and compliance.
* Identify process optimisation opportunities to maximise ROI and enhance system reliability.
* Design and deliver IT Solutions
* Translate business needs into clear functional and technical specifications.
* Lead landscape and solution design and deployment using Agile practices, ensuring security and data privacy standards.
* Validate and refine solutions through testing to guarantee business value.
* Enable Continuous Improvement
* Champion change management and user adoption strategies for new technologies.
* Promote knowledge sharing and best practices to drive innovation across teams.


**Experiences**
 WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR:
   

  

* Bachelor's degree, preferably in Business Administration or Information Management.
* At least three years of experience in Information Systems management, business application design, and development.
* Minimum two years of project management experience; Agile or PMP certification is preferred.
* Ability to understand and create functional and technical documentation, such as landscape diagrams, API specifications, and business process designs.
* Advanced computer literacy, including the capability to analyse and write in technical language.
* ITIL knowledge is considered an asset.


**Competencies**
* Analytically strong, knowing when to shift from the bigger picture to the tiny detail and back.
* Learning on the fly, today’s skills are tomorrow’s history.
* A team player while maintaining a strong own vision and goal.
* Capable to shift focus in rapid changing requirements.


 Ultimately, personality means more to us than skills. If you have the passion and mindset, we’d urge you to apply: we will help you develop the skills.
   

  

**WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US?**
 At PMI IT, We Believe Success To Be Fuelled By Our Employees, Depended On Them Coming To Work Every Single Day With a Sense Of Purpose And An Appetite For Challenge. We Are a People First Organisation Committed To Empowering You To Take Risks, Grow And Explore. Here’s What Sets Us Apart
   

  

* We’re redefining the big picture of well-being and personal development. We seek the best professionals but recognize them as parents, caregivers, family, and community members. We look after each other and care for our people, so wherever you join us around the world, we’re committed to providing the type of benefits only a company like PMI can offer
* Being the fastest learning IT organization in the world is core to our culture, so we invest significantly in developing our people. From mentoring to technical certifications, stretch roles, soft skills development, and executive education, we help our people develop the skills they need to do their best work and create their own unique impact.
* At PMI IT, we believe diversity and inclusiveness are essential to every industry. We’re proud that our culture is built upon strong corporate values, a foundation of respect and belonging, and a commitment to diversity and inclusion that welcomes a variety of skill sets, backgrounds, and experiences.
* We see digital technology as disruptive, and possibilities as endless. Our teams work with innovative technologies such as Cloud, APIs, IoT and AI, supported by management practices and principles such as Agile, Design Thinking, and Product Management.


 Every single IT member is part of our Transformation journey. Join us and pursue your ambitions – our staggering size and scale provides endless opportunities to progress. If our culture and mindset resonate with you, we look forward to receiving your application and getting to know you.
   

  

 Together, let’s deliver a smoke free future.
   

  

**Things To Know Before You Apply**
* If you have been in your current job for less than 12 months or if you are on a Performance Improvement Programme, you must get the approval of your current manager before applying for the job.
* To find out more about eligibility to apply for internal jobs, please refer to the Open Sourcing Employee Guidebook on the Internal Careers Portal


 #SWMA
   

  

**17157**

title: AD-tekniker
description:
Vi söker en erfaren AD-tekniker till ett uppdrag inom en större offentlig organisation. Miljön består av en omfattande och komplex plattformsdrift med starkt fokus på Microsoft-baserade infrastrukturtjänster. Uppdraget innebär att bidra i förvaltningen av centrala identitets- och åtkomsttjänster samt arbeta nära befintligt driftteam i en stabil och strukturerad IT-miljö.
   

  

**Uppdragsbeskrivning / arbetsuppgifter**
 Konsulten kommer att ingå i gruppen för drift av plattformar med ansvar för teknisk förvaltning av:
   

  

* Active Directory (AD)
* Microsoft Identity Manager (MIM)
* Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS)
* Entra ID (tidigare Azure AD)


**Arbetet Omfattar**
* Daglig drift, administration och uppföljning av identitets- och katalogtjänster
* Installation, konfigurering och felsökning inom ovanstående tjänsteområden
* Hantering av löpande ärenden, förändringar och aktiviteter
* Omvärldsbevakning samt rekommendationer kring förbättringar och säkerhetsförstärkningar
* Arbete med incidenter och avvikelser i miljöer baserade på Microsofts produkter
* Samarbete med interna team och strukturerat arbete enligt etablerade processer


**Skallkrav**
* Minst tre års erfarenhet (inom de senaste sju åren) av administration, daglig drift, installation, konfigurering och felsökning av Microsoft Windows Server Active Directory (AD) 2016 eller senare.
* Minst tre års erfarenhet (inom de senaste sju åren) av administration, daglig drift, installation, konfigurering och felsökning av Entra ID (tidigare Azure AD).
* Möjlighet att arbeta på plats i Örebrokontoret fem dagar per vecka (obligatoriskt krav).


**Meriterande**
* Minst ett års erfarenhet (inom de senaste fem åren) av daglig drift, installation, konfigurering och felsökning av MIM.
* Minst ett års erfarenhet (inom de senaste fem åren) av daglig drift, installation, konfigurering och felsökning av ADFS.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta enligt ITIL 3.5.


**Personliga egenskaper**
* Arbetar strukturerat, lösningsorienterat och med hög ansvarskänsla
* Har god kommunikationsförmåga och kan samarbeta i team
* Är noggrann, kvalitetsfokuserad och trygg i att arbeta i komplexa miljöer
* Har ett proaktivt förhållningssätt och bidrar med förbättringsförslag


**Start:** 
 2026-01-07
   

  

**Slut:** 
 2026-06-30 (möjlighet till förlängning upp till 6 månader)
   

  

**Omfattning:** 
 100 %
   

  

**Plats:** 
 På plats i Örebrokontoret, fem dagar per vecka

title: Associate Operations Manager - Strategy & Operations
description:
Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions – as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt’s products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants) and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt’s mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 29 countries today, 25 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.
   

  

  





**So, why work at Wolt?**




 At Wolt, we’re about getting things done.
   

  

  





 You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.
   

  

  





 We work hard to make cities into better places, and it’s pretty cool seeing us grow every week. If you’re passionate about building things that just… work, Wolt might be for you.
   

  

  





**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**
  

  

  

 We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.
   

  

  





***Join us today to build Wolt together.***




  

  

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 Join a forward-leaning and agilent team at Wolt as an Associate Operations Manager in region North!
   

  

  





 As an Associate Operations Manager in the Regional Strategy & Operations team, you will be responsible for driving innovation, implementation and execution across all aspects of our operations. This particular role will have a major focus on leading our ambitions to make autonomous deliveries a natural part of our operations across the region. It will also include working with other key areas and challenging problems while spearheading the innovation for new ideas; whether it is a new courier partnership model, a new sustainability project or a new delivery mode all together. In this, you will be responsible for bringing structure to ambiguous situations and own the forward progress. You will collaborate across individuals, teams and functions, bringing your natural knack for ownership, execution and problem-solving.
   

  

  





 Reporting directly to the Regional Head of Strategy & Innovation as part of Regional Operations, your role is crucial in achieving ambitious targets in all countries and all business lines that we operate in.
   

  

  





**What you’ll be doing**




 This is a multi-faced and highly varied role, but the major areas of responsibilities including tasks are:
   

  

  




* Own the operational part of autonomous deliveries - incl. vision & strategy, partnership negotiations, feasibility studies, unit economics, product development coordination and scale-up of operations.
* Identify and suggest new business and project opportunities within the scope Strategy & Innovation, based on industry insights and data driven hypotheses
* Utilize your analytical skills to create data driven hypotheses of how to solve complex problems involving all sides of the Wolt platform and business environment.
* Lead and own responsibility areas in focus that you oversee from ideation to implementation and follow-up, with the potential of leading a team in the future
* Effectively collaborate with internal and external stakeholders across all functions of the company to ensure progress for your specific responsibility areas including but not limited to product, marketing, legal, policy, local and global business teams.
* Monitor KPIs and conduct analysis to unpack why performance is what it is and devising strategies to meet or exceed the targets for region North


**Our humble expectations**
* Strong sense of ownership and accountability for end results
* Experience from operational autonomy development and implementation
* Proactive "doer" mentality, with willingness to fail and open to learn from mistakes
* Self-driven and able to fill your own and team members’ work weeks with tasks, based on agreed purposes and end-states for the direction of the team and the company
* Solves problems independently and proactively
* Experienced manager, that has led both big and small projects and teams before with successful, measurable results
* Passionate about new technology and innovative ways to operate
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Swedish (other Nordic languages is a plus)
* Proficient in digital collaboration tools like GSuite, Slack, and Zoom


**Next Steps**

 We preferably look for a candidate based in Stockholm, to work from our office there but for the perfect candidate other countries in the Nordics, Baltics and Luxemburg can be discussed. If the above sounds like you, or someone you know, please don’t hesitate to reach out. We look forward to your application!
   

  

  





 If you have any further questions about the position before submitting an application, you can turn to:
   

  

 Laura Ilioaea - Talent Acquisition Partner
   

  

 laura.ilioaea@external.wolt.com
   

  

  





 Please note that we do not accept applications coming in via email. Please submit your application in English via our career page.

title: Head of IT
description:
*Trygghet handlar inte längre bara om lås, larm och grannsamverkan. I dag avgörs den lika mycket av hur vi skyddar oss i den digitala världen. Hos SSF Stöldskyddsföreningen, en oberoende ideell organisation med uppdrag inom Sveriges nationella cybersäkerhetsstrategi, får du som Head of IT en nyckelroll i att stärka samhällets motståndskraft mot digitala hot, genom att modernisera och vidareutveckla SSF:s tekniska miljö.* 




  





 Det här är en roll för dig som vill använda din kompetens till något större. Hos oss blir du en del av ett uppdrag som gör skillnad, varje dag, för hela samhället
 **.** 




  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Head of IT tar du ett helhetsgrepp om SSF:s digitala utveckling och säkerställer att vår IT-miljö är stabil, säker och framtidssäkrad. Du har ett tydligt strategiskt ansvar för att tekniken driver verksamheten framåt – från drift och informationssäkerhet till utveckling av nya digitala plattformar.
 



  





 Rollen är både strategisk och hands-on. Du arbetar nära ledningen i frågor som rör digitalisering, molntjänster, informationssäkerhet och SSF:s externa digitala initiativ, samtidigt som du har en naturlig operativ närvaro i det dagliga arbetet.
 



  





 Du ansvarar för hela IT-miljön – drift, användarstöd, arkitektur, säkerhet och utveckling – och leder samarbetet med vår externa leverantör för att säkerställa en modern och robust teknisk plattform. Du rapporterar till VD och arbetar tvärfunktionellt med ledning, verksamhetschefer, systemägare och externa partners för att driva digitalisering och skapa långsiktigt värde genom tekniken.
 



  





**Ditt uppdrag** 




 I rollen som Head of IT omsätter du SSF:s digitala strategi i praktiken och skapar förutsättningar för att teknik och verksamhet ska gå hand i hand. Du har både det strategiska ansvaret och den praktiska överblicken; från arkitektur och säkerhet till arbetssätt och utveckling. Du blir den samlande länken mellan teknik, verksamhet och samhällsuppdrag, med fokus på att göra IT till en möjliggörare för hela organisationen.
 


* Ansvara för och vidareutveckla SSF:s IT-strategi, budget, upphandlingar och leverantörssamarbeten
* Säkerställa en robust IT-arkitektur, informationssäkerhet och integrationer mellan affärssystem och digitala plattformar.
* Leda digitaliseringsprojekt och driva initiativ som effektiviserar och stärker verksamheten.
* Utveckla strukturer och arbetssätt i Microsoft 365 samt stötta användarna i deras digitala vardag.
* Bedöma och införa nya teknologier som skapar långsiktigt värde för verksamheten.



  





**Vem du är** 




 Vi tror att du har en bred bakgrund inom IT och vill använda den till att göra verklig skillnad. Du har erfarenhet av att leda IT- eller digitaliseringsarbete, gärna i en mindre till medelstor organisation där du själv varit både strateg och doer.
 



  





 Du känner dig hemma i Microsoft 365-miljöer, har god förståelse för informationssäkerhet och har arbetat med externa drift- och supportpartners. Du är trygg i att balansera det långsiktiga och det vardagliga, från budget och strategi till operativa uppgifter och användarstöd. Framför allt har du ett genuint intresse för hur teknik kan skapa trygghet, effektivitet och samhällsnytta.
 



  





 Som person är du kommunikativ, strukturerad och prestigelös. Du samarbetar gärna med andra, trivs med att växla mellan detalj och helhet och ser värdet i att bygga en digital grund som gör skillnad på riktigt.
 



  





**Teknisk miljö** 




 SSF:s IT-landskap är molnbaserat och modernt, med Microsoft 365 i centrum. Miljön omfattar bland annat:
 


* Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive, Exchange, Azure AD, Intune och Defender
* NetSuite (Oracle) som affärssystem
* Sophos för IT-säkerhet
* Webbplattformar som säkerhetskollen.se, ssf.nu och Grannsamverkan



  





**Varför SSF?** 




 SSF arbetar för att förebygga brott och öka tryggheten i hela samhället, både i det fysiska och det digitala rummet. Vi är en del av Sveriges nationella cybersäkerhetsstrategi, leder projekt som Cybernavet och Säkerhetskollen, är huvudman för Grannsamverkan som omfattar 30 % av Sveriges hushåll, och utsedda av EU till Trusted Flagger för att motverka digital brottsligh
 



 et online. Hos oss får du arbeta i en organisation där teknik, samhällsnytta och innovation möts. Vi är ett engagerat team med korta beslutsvägar, starkt driv och en gemensam vilja att skapa förändring.
 



  





**Om SSF Stöldskyddsföreningen** 




 SSF är en oberoende ideell organisation som sedan 1934 har arbetat för ett tryggare samhälle. Vi samarbetar med Polisen, MSB, försäkringsbolag, banker, företag och myndigheter för att förebygga brott och sprida kunskap. Vårt arbete finansieras genom våra produkter, utbildningar och tjänster – och varje insats bidrar direkt till att öka tryggheten i Sverige.
 



  





 Hos SSF möts du av en engagerad och värderingsstyrd kultur där vi värnar om nöjda medarbetare och en hållbar arbetsmiljö. Vi sitter i moderna, aktivitetsbaserade lokaler på Södermalm – anpassade för fokus, samarbete och kreativt arbete.
 



  





 Läs mer på
 **sakerhetskollen.se/privat** 
 och
 **ssf.nu** 




  





**Placering** 




 Tjänsten är placerad på SSF:s kontor i Stockholm (Rosenlundsgatan 29A)
 



  





**Vill du vara med och stärka Sveriges digitala trygghet?** 




 Välkommen med din ansökan! Om du har några frågor är du välkommen att kontakta antingen Ludvig Nilsson, ludvig.nilsson@ants.se, Senior Talent Acquisition Partner, eller Lisa Lilieqvist, lisa.lileqvist@ants.se, Senior Talent Acquisition Partner.

title: Business Analyst
description:
**Job Title: Business Analyst - Payments** 




**Location: Stockholm, Sweden - Hybrid: 3 Days to Office Every Week** 




**Duration: 6 Months - Extendable** 




**Employment Type: Contract B2B** 




  





**Roles & Responsibilities:** 



* Analyse business requirements, technical functionality, system processes and solution designs
* Write, maintain and develop system, business and functional requirements to guide the development work with our new payment infrastructure platform
* Maintain and develop systems for requirement management, documentation and follow-up
* Manage relation and drive discussions with internal/external stakeholders and development teams
* Be part of a cross functional agile team in the Payment Execution Agile Release Train that run the SAFe agile framework.
* Work closely and learn from domain experts in payments, architecture and mainframe systems
* Develop yourself, contribute to the development of your team and the entire release train.
* Be part of a dynamic environment with cross functional teams that share challenges and build knowledge together



**Skills/experience needed in this role:** 



* At least 3 years’ experience from requirement work in complex software systems
* Knowledge of common methods and tools used in requirement management
* Experience from banking, finance or insurance industries
* Work experience from the payment domain is an advantage
* Experience from ongoing initiatives such as ISO20022, Bank/plusgiro transformation, SEPA or similar is helpful
* A team player with good collaboration and communication skills
* Experience from agile ways of working, e.g. SAFe, scrum etc
* Ability to communicate with IT and business stakeholders to reach a common understanding of the work that needs to be done
* A driven, proactive, self-organized and an analytical approach with a strive to continuously improve
* Proficient in English, spoken and written, Swedish is a plus

title: Workforce Management Planner
description:
Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions – as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt’s products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants) and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt’s mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 29 countries today, 25 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.
   

  

  





**So, why work at Wolt?**




 At Wolt, we’re about getting things done.
   

  

  





 You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.
   

  

  





 We work hard to make cities into better places, and it’s pretty cool seeing us grow every week. If you’re passionate about building things that just… work, Wolt might be for you.
   

  

  





**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**
  

  

  

 We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.
   

  

  





***Join us today to build Wolt together.***




  

  

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 As a WFM Planner, you will join a dynamic Workforce Management team, collaborating with 5-6 other WFM planners to own and deliver capacity plans for your region. You will work closely with a dedicated WFM Analyst and be supported by a Global Planning Lead to ensure data-driven decision-making and optimal operational efficiency. Together, you will develop robust frameworks, analyze scenarios, and deliver actionable insights to help the organization meet its service-level agreements and cost targets.
   

  

  





 This role requires strong analytical skills, a proactive approach to problem-solving, and the ability to manage complex, multi-country capacity planning efforts effectively.
   

  

  





**Your Mission:**



* Create and manage long term forecasting, capacity plans and hiring plans for your region, covering multiple sites and approximately eight countries, ensuring customer support aligns with service-level agreements.
* Generate reports on performance metrics such as handling time, occupancy, shrinkage, and other operational metrics, transforming data into actionable insights to improve efficiency.
* Conduct ad-hoc scenario simulations and sensitivity analyses to ensure optimal resource allocation under varying conditions.
* Provide recommendations and drive changes to improve customer experience, agent well-being, and cost-efficiency, considering factors like contracts, skills, and queue setups.
* Lead planning governance for your region, including facilitating sessions with product, operations, finance, and recruitment teams to incorporate changes and produce actionable hiring plans.
* Regularly review and enhance the Mean Absolute Percentage Error (MAPE) of forecasts.
* Co-own quarterly OKR target-setting with your Global Planning Lead to align with organizational objectives.
* Build basic data automations to increase the efficiency of Workforce Management processes.


**Our humble expectations**
* You have experience in forecasting, capacity planning, and scenario modeling within a Workforce Management context.
* You possess a strong ability to analyze data, develop actionable insights, and create detailed performance reports. Advanced skills in Excel or similar tools are essential; familiarity with BI tools like Looker is a plus.
* You can independently identify and address issues, even in ambiguous or unfamiliar situations.
* You have a track record of identifying opportunities for automation and efficiency improvements, with a focus on optimizing outcomes.
* You excel at managing relationships with internal and cross-functional teams, ensuring alignment and clear communication.
* You are adept at translating strategy into operational plans, considering customer needs, agent well-being, and organizational goals.
* You are a self-starter who takes ownership of challenges and drives solutions proactively.


**Next Steps**

 If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an extremely ambitious team, then click below to apply and get the conversation going!
   

  

  





 We will be reviewing applications on an on-going basis, so if this sounds like an opportunity you want to pursue, apply today!
   

  

  





 If you have any further questions about the position before submitting an application, you can turn to:
   

  

 Laura Ilioaea - Talent Acquisition Partner
   

  

 laura.ilioaea@external.wolt.com
   

  

  





 Please note that we do not accept applications coming in via email. Please submit your application in English via our career page.
