You’ll have the opportunity to work on cross-functional initiatives and projects in a fast-paced, highly entrepreneurial environment with a great deal of autonomy. You’ll become an expert in the global payments landscape and level up your skills through our AM Academy.
   

  

 We are looking for a proactive and adaptable Account Manager to join our team in Stockholm. The ideal candidate is a strategic thinker with a hands-on mentality; someone who is eager to help the world’s biggest brands grow while changing an industry. You are excited to work with a global, multicultural team in a collaborative manner and help your team succeed. Your focus will be on delivering an outstanding customer experience to our mid-sized, fast-growth merchants, finding new opportunities, and driving mutual success for Adyen and our customers.
   

  

**Account Manager**
 Our Account Managers are encouraged to challenge each other and sharpen ideas as a team, because winning is more important than ego. In this role, you’ll get excited by working on a wide portfolio of mid-sized, fast-growth merchants across a variety of verticals. Through a pooled Account Management approach, you’ll work alongside a group of talented and driven Account Managers. Together, you’ll focus on efficiency and proactivity whilst developing customer relationships and driving commercial growth for your accounts.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Collaboration- As an Account Manager, you will work closely with other Account Managers; collaborating on many different accounts across a wide range of industries.
* Relationship management- Responsible for ramping and growing customers with a focus on commercial growth, customer satisfaction, and reducing churn.
* Commercial acumen- Drive commercial discussions for joint accounts, while striving to meet strategic and financial targets.
* Project management- Prioritize and manage short and long term projects with varying timelines across multiple accounts, leveraging internal support teams where relevant.
* Technical Affinity- Analytical and data-driven thinker who feels comfortable with spreadsheet analysis and technical discussions about the nuances of payments.
* Feedback- Serve as a feedback loop for your customers internally.


**Who You Are**
* Enjoy engaging others and developing strong working relationships internally and externally with customers.
* You're a natural-born networker and self-starter, and your communication skills make it easy for you to organize and lead customer meetings in person, over the phone, or online.
* Passionate about working on a wide portfolio of accounts and having the opportunity to learn about many aspects of the payments industry
* Eager to challenge yourself to identify commercial opportunities and drive commercial discussions with customers
* Strong time management skills and constantly looking for ways to work efficiently


**Additional Requirements**
* You have 1-3 years of full-time work experience in a client-facing, commercial role, like account management, consulting, or in the payments industry from a merchant side (bonus if in complex enterprise software, technical infrastructure or financial services)
* This role is based out of our Stockholm office. We have a hybrid workplace and value in-person collaboration; we do not offer remote-only roles.
* You have full professional written and verbal proficiency in Swedish and English (other languages are a plus).
* Some domestic and international travel is required.


**Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion commitments**
 Our unique approach is a product of our diverse perspectives. This diversity of backgrounds and cultures is essential in helping us maintain our momentum. Our business and technical challenges are unique, and we need as many different voices as possible to join us in solving them - voices like yours. No matter who you are or where you’re from, we welcome you to be your true self at Adyen.
   

  

 Studies show that women and members of underrepresented communities apply for jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Does this sound like you? If so, Adyen encourages you to reconsider and apply. We look forward to your application!
   

  

**What’s next?**
 Ensuring a smooth and enjoyable candidate experience is critical for us. We aim to get back to you regarding your application within 5 business days. Our interview process tends to take about 4 weeks to complete, but may fluctuate depending on the role. Learn more about our hiring process here. Don’t be afraid to let us know if you need more flexibility.
   

  

 This role is based out of our Stockholm office. We are an office-first company and value in-person collaboration; we do not offer remote-only roles.

title: Agent Excellence Area Manager
description:
At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fueled by dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".
   

  

 We are now looking for an
 **Agent Excellence Area Manager** 
 to join Nissan Benelux & Scandinavia (eNEST).
   

  

**How you can contribute and have an impact?**
* Coordinate the performance of a group of agents/workshops.
* Drive vehicle sales achievement in the area (COT); do analysis on dispersion and follow up conversion and support agent if lack of performance.
* Oversee agent pipeline check; have control of sold vehicles and monitor that delivery happens in due scope and follow up booking in SMIT tool. Also inform distribution/performance manager if you notice lack of model/powertrains to handle BO or increase sales.
* Lead the Swedish aftersales performance, main KPI's are Parts sales, Acc. Sales, retention. Follow up on targets and dispersion.
* Ensure that Customer Quality (CQ), UC, training and Loyalty programs are controlled and managed by agents. Measure, control and report on customer quality performance of all the sales outlets and separate workshops.
* Follow up and coach staff members at agents/workshops in our processes (sales process, delivery process and customer quality processes, aftersales processes) to secure performance.
* Reporting and forecasting to Performance Manager and update the organization on zone performance in relevant forums.
* Support following up the commercial policy on Sales and aftersales, (campaigns, demo and display & courtesy cars program, CQ processes, communication)
* Ensure dispersion / benchmark are communicated within team and network and actions are in place at low performers
* Follow up and coach agents for local Marketing, Loyalty and Communication activities, in cooperation with the Retail Marketing Coordinator
* Follow up that agent staff are educated in accordance with our Training calendar (e-learnings and classroom training)
* Follow up and control that dealerships are living up to our showroom standards
* Participate to induction programs for new dealers
* Participate in weekly RBU Team meetings, Agent group review meetings (quarterly), various regional internal and agent review meetings
* Communicate performance on COT weekly with all agents within region.


**What we look for:**
* Minimum 3 years' professional experience preferably within the automotive industry
* Higher education at Bachelors' level administration, business or equivalent experience
* Experience within sales/after sales, leading to demonstrably strong skills and ability to discuss on various levels within a dealership
* Experience with an international, matrix organization is advantageous
* Fluency Swedish and English is a must
* Excellent relationship management skills
* Proficient use of Microsoft Office


 Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.
   

  

 Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.
   

  

 Kista Sweden

title: Technical Product Manager
description:
Vill du jobba i gränslandet mellan teknik, produkt och användarupplevelse? Hos oss får du chansen att leda spännande projekt i en innovativ miljö där fotboll möter teknik. Nu söker vi en Technical Product Manager som även axlar ett produktnära ansvar och vill ta lead i en dynamisk och snabbföränderlig miljö.
 



  





**Information om företaget** 




 Föreningen Svensk Elitfotboll (SEF) driver EFIT – den gemensamma, molnbaserade digitala plattformen som knyter ihop alla 32 klubbar i Allsvenskan och Superettan. Via Fotbollskonto, liga- och klubbappar, streamingtjänster och partnerlösningar levererar vi biljetter, video, officiell statistik och upplevelser till hundratusentals supportrar – och ger klubbar och partners kraftfulla verktyg för affärsutveckling. Vårt mål är ett sammanhållet digitalt ekosystem i världsklass för svensk elitfotboll.
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter** 




 Rollen är bred och varierad där du jobbar nära CTO, tekniska projektledare, utvecklare och andra intressenter. Du är både Technical Product Manager och ett operativt stöd inom produktområdet: du leder tekniska utvecklingsprojekt, stöttar utvecklare, gräver i data, koordinerar arbetet och ser till att rätt saker byggs i rätt tid. Vi ser gärna att du gillar att kavla upp ärmarna och ta eget initiativ i en start-up-liknande miljö.
 



  





 Du kommer bland annat att:
 


* Leda, definiera och prioritera produktinitiativ genom hela utvecklingscykeln
* Säkerställa produktkvalitet och framgångskriterier före och efter lansering
* Stötta utvecklingsteam med problemlösning, ärendehantering och teknisk dokumentation
* Aktivt nyttja AI-verktyg som Claude, Claude Code och Cursor för snabbare leveranser och bättre lösningar
* Analysera dataflöden i en distribuerad systemarkitektur för att identifiera förbättringar och integrationsmöjligheter
* Kommunicera produktvision, tekniska begränsningar och framsteg till intressenter
* Driva produktutveckling genom samarbete med design, utveckling och affärsteam
* Bygga processer och struktur i växande miljöer



  





**Vi söker dig som** 



* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av teknisk produkt-/projektledning inom mjukvaruutveckling, helst SaaS
* Förmåga att arbeta cross-funktionellt med flera intressenter och externa leverantörer (ex. IT-konsulter, CRM, betalning, identitetssystem)
* Djup förståelse för produktutveckling, användarnytta och teknisk genomförbarhet
* Teknisk skicklighet för att självständigt navigera komplexa miljöer, analysera systemarkitektur och dataflöden över distribuerade system
* Daglig vana att nyttja moderna AI-verktyg som Claude Code för problemlösning och snabbare leveranser
* Förmåga att prioritera initiativ, fatta pragmatiska beslut och balansera affärsbehov mot tekniska begränsningar
* Erfarenhet av Azure/GCP/AWS, eventdriven arkitektur, durable workflows, REST API:er, React, React Native, SQL och datawarehouse-lösningar (Snowflake/BigQuery/RedShift). Bekant med verktyg som Linear, Notion, Figma, Postman, Looker och Linux terminal/CLIs
* Flytande svenska och engelska



  





**Meriterande** 



* Har utvecklat applikationer från grunden eller genom AI-assisterad utveckling (t.ex. v0, Lovable)
* Väl förtrogen med teknisk dokumentation (t.ex. OpenAPI/Swagger) och supportnära ärendehantering
* Behärskar motstridande prioriteringar och hittar pragmatiska lösningar
* Van att jobba i miljöer där struktur byggs upp successivt



  





**Personliga egenskaper** 




 Vi tror att dina personliga egenskaper är avgörande för hur väl du kommer trivas i rollen hos Svensk Elitfotboll. Du är initiativtagande och trivs med självständighet och ägarskap i en dynamisk miljö. Du har ett analytiskt och kreativt tänkesätt med helhetssyn, och du är kommunikativ över både tekniska och affärsmässiga gränser – vilket gör att du får rätt saker att hända vid rätt tid.
 



  





**Du erbjuds** 



* Ett team med stark passion för både teknik, produktutveckling och fotboll
* Möjligheten att påverka och utveckla digitala produkter med stor synlighet och engagemang
* En arbetsplats med start-up-anda, korta beslutsvägar, högt i tak och lågt ego
* Stora möjligheter till bred och djupgående kompetensutveckling inom teknik, produktutveckling, och dataanalys
* En kultur där nyfikenhet, lärande, samarbete och innovation står i centrum



  





**Information om tjänsten** 




 Professionals Nord söker i samarbete med Svensk Elitfotboll en Technical Product Manager. Uppdraget är en del av vår personaluthyrning. Du kommer vara anställd av Professionals Nord och arbeta som konsult hos Svensk Elitfotboll. Intentionen är att du på sikt ska kunna bli anställd direkt hos dem, förutsatt att alla parter är nöjda med samarbetet.
 



 Den här rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Professionals Nord och Svensk Elitfotbolls önskemål är att alla frågor kring tjänsten går till info@pn.se.
 



  





**START:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



**OMFATTNING:** 
 Heltid
 



**URVAL:** 
 Sker löpande
 



**KONTAKT:** 
 info@pn.se

title: Group Strategy Manager
description:
**Do you want to take ownership of the strategy enablement at Conscia? We are now looking for a Group Strategy Manager, based in Copenhagen or Stockholm, Denmark/Sweden to be responsible for steering the strategy deployment and enablement across the Conscia Group.** 




  





**Conscia is one of the leading providers of secure IT infrastructure solutions in Northern Europe with local offices in Denmark, Sweden, Norway, the Netherlands, Slovenia and Germany where we build, service and secure some of Europe’s most complex IT infrastructures. You will get the opportunity for personal development and growth and you will be expected to take responsibility and deliver results.** 




  





**Is this an opportunity for you? Please contact us or apply now!** 




  





**About the Role** 




 This purpose of this role is to play an integral role in driving Conscia’s long term strategic growth and performance, partnering with functional leaders, translate strategy into action and drive operational excellence and efficiency throughout our business. The role works closely with, and reports directly to, Conscia’s Chief Strategy and Integration Officer.
 



  





**Goals for the role:** 



* Business/Geographical units fulfillment of Strategic initiatives
* Successful execution of strategic assessment projects
* Evolvement, improvement, clarity and communicability of Conscia’s Corporate strategy
* Number and depth of trust based relationships with Conscia Leadership



  





**Critical responsibilities in the role:** 



* Test hypotheses through analytical rigor, collaborating across the company to ensure alignment and data integrity
* Research, analyse and recommend courses of action that directly contribute to tangible outcomes
* Analysing expansion opportunities and internal performance
* Manage and evolve our corporate dashboards, reporting and goal setting process (OKRs) to ensure corporate strategy is effectively translated into defined workstreams, Value Creation Plans and aligned across the group
* Work with other functional areas of the company to orchestrate change initiatives that help scale the company and to help secure commitment for cross-company efforts
* Acts as Project Manager for planning and execution of operational excellence projects leading cross functional teams of leaders and subject matter experts
* Act as a change agent promoting excellence and innovative thinking with employees at all levels of the organisation



  





**About the You** 




 We are looking for a candidate with a relevant master degree and at least two years of strategy/management consulting experience. Experience from IT/Tech industry will ease your onboarding drasticly and same if you have experience from working in group function. Our company language is English and you must be fluent both in writing and speaking. In terms of team and culture fit we are looking for:
 


* a team player with strong curiosity
* a good listener and communicator who will create strong long term professional business relationships
* Working structured, analytical and based on methodical planning skills is crucial
* a result oriented person who thrives driving projects and solutions independently



  





**Application** 




 Did we get you inspired? If so, we look forward to hearing from you!
 



 Applications will be read and interviews will be conducted continuously.
 



  





**About us** 




 As an employer Conscia is committed to
 **Secure Your Progress** 
 and to us this means an employee experience based on
 **Securing your Growth** 
 ,
 **Securing your Impact** 
 ,
 **Securing your Knowledge** 
 and
 **Securing your Flexibility** 
 , for further information please visit
 
 www.conscia.com
 
 .
 



  





 Conscia is a leading European provider of secure, reliable IT infrastructure solutions with DKK ~2.5B in revenue. Conscia strive to be the best partner for customers mission critical IT infrastructure throughout the entire lifecycle. And supports this through deep insight gathered in a unique customer platform, ‘CNS’, which is the basis for industry-leading customer experience and satisfaction. At the same time Conscia has the ambition to be the most attractive and admired place to work for talented IT infrastructure specialists with deep technical expertise. The current Network of Knowledge is 750+ employees spread across 6 countries (Denmark, Sweden, Norway, The Netherlands, Slovenia and Germany). For further information, please visit
 
 www.conscia.com

title: Senior Backend Engineer - Data Platform
description:
We’re looking for a Senior Backend Engineer to join Spotify’s Data Platform team. We in the Data Infrastructure Product Area, enable Spotify to solve complex and critical data engineering problems by providing a platform and tooling for the production, management and consumption of high-quality data. We are an amplifier for efficiency, quality, and innovation across Spotify. You’ll design, build and develop scalable infrastructure services and tools, and collaborate in a cross-functional team. In the DataEx squad, we are looking for a backend/data engineer to help us increase productivity, optionality and flexibility for data practitioners through scalable, portable and reliable data processing platforms.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* You’ll collaborate with product and engineering to build and support the infrastructure that empowers Spotify teams to process data to solve critical business needs.
* Increase developer productivity by building innovative tools that reduce overhead of working with data pipelines, help increase platform reliability, and are cost-efficient.
* Work with engineers with deep expertise in data and collaborate closely with squads in Spotify to drive improvements in the data processing ecosystem through support, best-practices and standards.
* Help the platform orchestrate data jobs in a seamless way, for the users not having to worry about what is happening “under the hood”


 Who You Are
   

  

* You are proficient in backend development using Java.
* You are comfortable working with big data using SQL and data analytics platforms such as BigQuery.
* You have experience with one or more higher-level JVM-based data processing frameworks such as Flink, Beam, Dataflow, Spark, etc.
* Devops is part of your day-to-day work and you are used to working with cloud-based infrastructure and services, containerised applications.
* You have some experience working with Kubernetes and are familiar with its basic concepts.
* You have experience of working with data engineering pipelines in Scala and/or Python.
* Quality is important to you and you know what it means to ship high-quality code.
* You appreciate agile software processes, and sound engineering practices like continuous delivery, defensive programming, and automated testing.
* You love working in an environment where you constantly experiment and iterate quickly. You are comfortable with ambiguity, enjoy working on open ended problems, and believe data is the most powerful tool for informed decision-making.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London or Stockholm.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: SECURITY ENGINEER IAM TILL BANKGIROT
description:
*Bankgirot söker nu Security Engineers med fokus på IAM/PAM/IGA till en växande del av organisationen i Stockholm. Bankgirot har en unik ställning på Sveriges betalmarknad som nu genomgår den största transformationen i modern tid. Vår IT-organisation är i en tillväxtfas för att utveckla framtidssäkrade lösningar som följer internationell standard och regelverk.*
*Samtidigt ser vi till att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar säkert och stabilt – varje dag. Arbetet med att utveckla framtidens betalinfrastruktur är i full gång och vi behöver dig som vill vara en del av resan. Som Security Engineer kommer du att spela en viktig roll i att säkerställa en säker, effektiv och compliant identitets- och åtkomsthantering – på ett teknikbolag där vi har ett stort hjärta för uppdraget – och för varandra.*
 Din roll
   

  

 Som Security Engineer med inriktning på IAM/PAM/IGA och åtkomstkontroll får du en nyckelroll i att övervaka, drifta och vidareutveckla Bankgirots säkerhetsplattformar för identitetshantering och autentisering. Du arbetar operativt med lösningar som Active Directory, PAM och MFA – med syftet att säkerställa att identitetsflöden, accesshantering och autentisering sker säkert, spårbart och i enlighet med regulatoriska krav.
   

  

 I rollen ingår att samverka med arkitektur- och plattformsområden för att säkerställa effektiva och säkra identitets- och behörighetsflöden samt att stötta verksamheten och realisera krav kring access och identitet Du deltar i säkerhetsgranskningar och revisioner, arbetar med att ansluta applikationer till centrala IDP-lösningar och stödjer automatisering av onboarding/offboarding och övriga IAM-flöden. Du bidrar även till det strategiska förbättringsarbetet av våra kontroller, metoder och dokumentation. Dina huvudsakliga fokusområden är att:
   

  

* Vidareutveckla och drifta IAM- och accessplattformar, inklusive PAM, MFA och IDP-lösningar
* Implementera tekniska säkerhetskontroller inom åtkomststyrning samt dokumentera och förbättra processer kopplade till identitetshantering
* Deltaga i säkerhetsgranskningar och revisioner samt samarbeta med SOC vid identitetsrelaterade incidenter
* Automatisera och effektivisera IAM-processer samt ansluta applikationer till centrala autentiseringstjänster


 Vi söker dig som har
   

  

 Du har en stark säkerhetsmedvetenhet och är van vid att arbeta i komplexa IT-miljöer där identitets- och åtkomsthantering är en central del av både säkerhets- och compliancearbetet. Med ett strukturerat och analytiskt arbetssätt tar du dig an tekniska utmaningar och bidrar aktivt till förbättringar.
   

  

 Vi ser att du har erfarenhet av teknisk drift, felsökning och utveckling av IAM-plattformar, inklusive komponenter som Active Directory, PAM, IGA, LDAP, MFA, IDP och Access Control. Du har god förståelse för IAM-livscykelhantering, autentisering och olika typer av behörighetsmodeller – och har sannolikt arbetat i miljöer med höga krav på efterlevnad och spårbarhet. Vidare har du kännedom om protokoll som SAML, OIDC, OAuth och WebauthN, samt erfarenhet av federerade identitetslösningar och säker autentisering för API:er. Det är meriterande om du har arbetat med lösningar såsom Curity, Omada och BeyondTrust, har erfarenhet av automatisering eller skriptning inom IAM samt innehar certifieringar som CISSP, CISM eller GIAC.
   

  

 Som person är du lösningsorienterad, noggrann och har ett genuint intresse för cybersäkerhet. Du trivs i en dynamisk och föränderlig miljö där samarbete är avgörande för att nå framgång. Med god kommunikationsförmåga, nyfikenhet och ett öga för struktur bidrar du till att skapa säkra, effektiva och hållbara lösningar i samverkan med både tekniska team och verksamheten i stort.
   

  

 Ett utvecklande arbete med bra förmåner
   

  

 Som vår nya kollega blir du en del av ett kompetent och positivt team där vi samarbetar och sätter högt värde på varandras kompetens och erfarenheter.
   

  

 Vi satsar mycket på hälsa och välmående och erbjuder generösa förmåner för dig som medarbetare.
   

  

 Övrig information
   

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning baserad i Liljeholmen i Stockholm. Du behöver ha goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Innan anställning beslutas genomförs en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).
   

  

 Intresserad?
   

  

 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Bankgirot med Nexer Recruit.
   

  

 Har du frågor eller funderingar? Kontakta gärna rekryteringskonsult Johanna Värmfors: johanna.varmfors@nexergroup.com eller +46 730 821 230 alternativt Jenny Nilsson: jenny.nilsson@nexergroup.com eller +46 703 018 279
   

  

 Läs om fler lediga tjänster från Bankgirot här.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Om Bankgirot
   

  

 Bankgirot är ett svenskt clearinghus och teknikbolag med över 60 års erfarenhet av att leverera finansiell infrastruktur till banker. I samverkan med betalsektorn ser vi till att privatpersoner och företag enkelt kan göra överföringar och betalningar.
   

  

 Bankgirot säkerställer att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar felfritt, samtidigt som vi utvecklar framtidssäkrade lösningar. Vi säkrar och utvecklar Sveriges betalningar.
   

  

 Läs mer på www.bankgirot.se

title: Senior Software Engineer - Android
description:
**About Applied Intuition**
 Applied Intuition is the vehicle intelligence company that accelerates the global adoption of safe, AI-driven machines. Founded in 2017 and now valued at $15 billion following its recent Series F funding round, Applied Intuition delivers the Vehicle OS, Self-Driving System, and toolchain to help customers build intelligent vehicles and shorten time to market. 18 of the top 20 global automakers and major programs across the Department of Defense trust Applied Intuition's solutions to deliver vehicle intelligence. Applied Intuition services the automotive, defense, trucking, construction, mining, and agriculture industries and is headquartered in Mountain View, CA, with offices in Washington, D.C., San Diego, CA, Ft. Walton Beach, FL, Ann Arbor, MI, London, Stuttgart, Munich, Stockholm, Bangalore, Seoul, and Tokyo. Learn more at applied.co.
   

  

*We are an in-office company, and our expectation is that employees primarily work from their Applied Intuition office 5 days a week. However, we also recognize the importance of flexibility and trust our employees to manage their schedules responsibly. This may include occasional remote work, starting the day with morning meetings from home before heading to the office, or leaving earlier when needed to accommodate family commitments. (Note: For EpiSci job openings, fully remote work will be considered by exception.)*
**Meet our engineers on the Vehicle OS team!**
 Vehicle OS is a flexible suite of products that help vehicle manufacturers develop, deploy, and update complete vehicle software and AI applications. Learn more about what the team is building, the team culture, and why it’s one of the most exciting projects at Applied Intuition.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for bright engineers interested in designing elegant solutions to difficult problems in the autonomy space. Our software engineers work across our suite of products, tackling difficult full-stack, infrastructure, robotics, and graphics problems. At Applied Intuition, we encourage engineers to take ownership over technical and product decisions, interact closely with users to collect feedback, and contribute to a thoughtful, dynamic team culture.
   

  

 At Applied Intuition, you will:
   

  

* Work across our entire stack to develop new products, features, and tools
* Have an unparalleled opportunity to work with domain experts across a variety of fields: infrastructure, robotics, and graphics engineers, as well as startup veterans
* Carve out your own area of expertise and influence product decisions
* Collaborate with other members in the autonomy ecosystem and learn about different approaches to solving core issues in autonomy


 We're looking for someone who has:
   

  

* Experience shipping complex software and writing production code
* Demonstrated ability to be a self-starter and can quickly become comfortable with new technical tools
* Designed efficient and effective solutions to a wide range of engineering challenges
* Ability to take initiative in a fast-paced environment


 Nice to have:
   

  

* Working knowledge of frontend, API layer, containerization, or cluster orchestration frameworks (such as React, GraphQL, Docker, or Kubernetes)
* Experience in Android AOSP
* Experience writing Python, C++, or Java


*Don’t meet every single requirement? If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.*
*Applied Intuition is an equal opportunity employer and federal contractor or subcontractor. Consequently, the parties agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-1.4(a), 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) and 41 CFR 60-741.5(a) and that these laws are incorporated herein by reference. These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their status as protected veterans or individuals with disabilities, and prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin. These regulations require that covered prime contractors and subcontractors take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status or disability. The parties also agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of Executive Order 13496 (29 CFR Part 471, Appendix A to Subpart A), relating to the notice of employee rights under federal labor laws.*

title: DevOps/Cloud Engineer (development focus)
description:
At Ubiquiti Inc., we create technology platforms for Businesses, Smart Homes, and Internet Service Providers, driven by our goal to connect everyone, everywhere. To date, Ubiquiti has shipped over 100 million devices worldwide, from ISP networking products to next generation of IT solutions. Our growth is made possible by the dedicated team of hundreds behind the scenes. From software developers and product managers to designers and strategists, Team UI is driven to achieve our common goal: Rethinking IT. At Ubiquiti, you’ll heighten your potential and broaden your horizons - all while shaping the future of connectivity.
   

  

**Join forces with us on our mission to build a better IT industry. We are currently looking for a highly skilled Cloud/DevOps Engineer with a development focus to our team in Stockholm, Sweden.**
***Please note that applicants must live in Sweden and hold a valid work permit at the time of application to be considered for this role.***
**Responsibilities**
* Develop internal systems to improve release management and developer enablement
* Maintain AWS infrastructure
* Develop efficient, scalable, and maintainable cloud services
* Integrate feature designs with larger software systems
* Co-work with cloud architects, backend developers, frontend developers, designers, and other stakeholders


**Requirements**
* 5+ years of experience in Node
* 5+ years of experience in the AWS ecosystem
* Experience working with Terraform
* Good understanding of React and TypeScript
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Strong sense of ownership of tasks and responsibilities
* Highly proficient in English (written and spoken)


**Nice To Have**
* Experience with Go or Java
* Experience with SD-WAN and/or VPN technologies
* Familiarity with the agile software development processes
* Experience in other major cloud service providers such as GCP or Azure


**Benefits**
* International work environment
* Competitive compensation package including wellness allowance, occupational pension, medical insurance, private health insurance, life insurance and work-injury insurance
* Five weeks of holiday per year
* Flexible work hours and hybrid work model
* Modern office space located in Epicenter (Hötorget)
* Access to all the latest Ubiquiti products and prototypes for home use and tests

title: SECURITY ENGINEER PKI/HSM TILL BANKGIROT
description:
*Bankgirot söker nu en Security Engineer med fokus på PKI och HSM till en växande del av organisationen i Stockholm. Bankgirot har en unik ställning på Sveriges betalmarknad som nu genomgår den största transformationen i modern tid. Vår IT-organisation är i en tillväxtfas för att utveckla framtidssäkrade lösningar som följer internationell standard och regelverk.*
*Samtidigt ser vi till att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar säkert och stabilt – varje dag. Arbetet med att utveckla framtidens betalinfrastruktur är i full gång och vi behöver dig som vill vara en del av resan. Som Security Engineer kommer du att spela en viktig roll i att bygga och förvalta lösningar för PKI, HSM, kryptografiska nycklar och certifikat – på ett teknikbolag där vi har ett stort hjärta för uppdraget, och för varandra.*
 Din roll
   

  

 I den här rollen ligger ditt primära fokus på att utveckla och drifta våra kryptografiska lösningar – från PKI-miljöer och certifikathantering till säker hantering av nycklar i HSM. Du säkerställer att våra system och tjänster vilar på en robust och tillförlitlig grund av modern kryptografi, i en miljö där säkerhet, tillgänglighet och kvalitet är avgörande.
   

  

 Arbetet innebär nära samarbete med både drift, utveckling och säkerhetsfunktioner, och du får möjlighet att bidra till både strategiska initiativ och praktisk implementation. Ditt främsta fokusområde är PKI och HSM, men du kan även få möjlighet att arbeta inom andra delar av säkerhet. Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:
   

  

* Konfigurera, drifta och vidareutveckla PKI- och HSM-lösningar
* Hantera och livscykelstyra kryptografiska nycklar och certifikat
* Säkerställa att lösningar följer interna säkerhetsprinciper och externa regulatoriska krav
* Delta i utveckling och dokumentation av rutiner, kontroller och processer kopplade till kryptografi
* Bidra med expertkunskap inom området i projekt och säkerhetsgranskningar


 Vi söker dig som har
   

  

 Du har ett genuint intresse för kryptografi och säkerhetslösningar och trivs i komplexa IT-miljöer där säkerhet och stabilitet är centrala delar. Med en lösningsorienterad och strukturerad approach drivs du av att verka i en dynamisk organisation i förändring.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har erfarenhet av PKI, certifikathantering och HSM samt god kunskap om kryptografiska nycklar och algoritmer. Särskilt värdefullt är om du har arbetat med Keyfactor EJBCA i en On-Prem-miljö och kan bidra med den kompetensen från start. Vi ser också gärna att du har förståelse för regulatoriska krav och standarder kopplade till säkerhet och betalningsinfrastruktur, och gärna en bredare bakgrund inom informations- eller IT-säkerhet. Det är även meriterande om du har erfarenhet av större transformationsresor eller säkerhetsramverk såsom Zero Trust, men din spets inom PKI och HSM är det centrala.
   

  

 Som person är du analytisk, samarbetsinriktad och kommunikativ. Du har en stark vilja att bidra till ständiga förbättringar och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap. Du förstår värdet av goda samarbeten – både inom teamet och tillsammans med andra delar av organisationen.
   

  

 Ett utvecklande arbete med bra förmåner
   

  

 Som vår nya kollega blir du en del av ett kompetent och positivt team där vi samarbetar och sätter högt värde på varandras kompetens och erfarenheter.
   

  

 Vi satsar mycket på hälsa och välmående och erbjuder generösa förmåner för dig som medarbetare.
   

  

 Övrig information
   

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning baserad i Liljeholmen i Stockholm. Du behöver ha goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Innan anställning beslutas genomförs en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).
   

  

 Intresserad?
   

  

 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Bankgirot med Nexer Recruit.
   

  

 Har du frågor eller funderingar? Kontakta gärna rekryteringskonsult Johanna Värmfors: johanna.varmfors@nexergroup.com eller +46 730 821 230 alternativt Jenny Nilsson: jenny.nilsson@nexergroup.com eller +46 703 018 279.
   

  

 Läs om fler lediga tjänster från Bankgirot här.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Om Bankgirot
   

  

 Bankgirot är ett svenskt clearinghus och teknikbolag med över 60 års erfarenhet av att leverera finansiell infrastruktur till banker. I samverkan med betalsektorn ser vi till att privatpersoner och företag enkelt kan göra överföringar och betalningar.
   

  

 Bankgirot säkerställer att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar felfritt, samtidigt som vi utvecklar framtidssäkrade lösningar. Vi säkrar och utvecklar Sveriges betalningar.
   

  

 Läs mer på www.bankgirot.se

title: Head of LAKA Commercial
description:
**Job Description**
**Shape the Future of Payments with Nexi in 2025**
 Envision a world where every transaction feels effortless, safe, and connected. At Nexi, we’re leading this transformation, building tools and solutions that redefine how the world pays. By joining us, you’ll play a part in creating the next generation of digital payments in an innovative, supportive and international environment.
   

  

 Why This Role is Right for You As Head of Large & Key Accounts, you’ll join a collaborative and forward-thinking team based in Stockholm.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Manage and lead our growth engine LAKA Commercial in Sweden.
* Accelerate our LAKA Sales team performance
* Responsible for front- and back book sales as well as retention
* Responsible for setting and implementing the strategy and commercial plan across the LAKA segment including adoption of new propositions
* Further accelerate an already strong sales mentality within our LAKA team
* Perform in line with yearly P&L objectives
* Challenge status quo to always strive for improvements across the value chain and enforce a “challenger” mentality always putting the customer first
* Define and follow up on clear KPIs for your direct reports
* Understand the dynamics of the market and identify opportunities to grow the business
* Recognize market developments and opportunities and translate them into effective top-line approaches and operational plans & programs
* Communicate the vision, strategy, and objectives throughout the organization, encouraging cross-divisional collaboration and teamwork to drive continuous improvement
* Be part of the Swedish leadership team and support our overall country agenda
* Work collaborative across teams and business units to support our growth agenda


**How you’ll do it:**
* Use your extensive and diverse leadership experience to influence, engage and build strategic and operational momentum for our growth journey in Sweden with specific focus on Large Accounts. You operate ”hands-on” as well as strategically with people and problems – aligning well with senior leadership teams and experts from Country to Nordics and Group functions level to create right mission and efficient execution plans.
* Leverage your strong and influential way of working to drive company organisation and culture to a high level of customer centricity focus and build a team that is able to take the company forward with both quality and pace.
* You utilise your strong skills in creative problem solving, structured way of working, and effective communication to make real and positive change.
* As a person you are accustom to working in crisis and with transformations. You like to explore and are curious to challenge the conventional thinking and push innovation.
* Strong ability to process complex information and focus on gather data driven insights and solutions.
* Set ambitious goals and drive a challenger mentality the ensure success


**What Makes You a Great Fit**
 We’re looking for someone eager to make a difference. Here’s what we value:
   

  

* Industry-leading knowledge of payments or a related industry including insight, key trends, merchant and customer behaviours.
* Strong leadership experience and clear track record of proving commercial impact through operational and strategic execution.
* Proven ability to develop, evolve and optimise effective Sales strategies, mentalities and value propositions – with experience of what “Great” products/services/mindsets that drives customer centricity are made and deployed.
* Significant track record of successful leadership in a complex, multi-national and diverse matrix environment.
* Fluent English and Swedish essential, fluency in another European language an advantage.


 Even if you don’t check every box, your unique potential and willingness to learn could set you apart.
   

  

**What’s in it for You?**
* Attractive salary and a competitive benefits package to reward your expertise and contributions
* Tech equipment: Get the tools you need to succeed, including the latest technology to support your work
* Join an international team: Collaborate with experts from across Europe and bring your ideas to life in a dynamic, global environment
* Grow and develop: Gain hands-on experience and structured training through our PayTech University, designed to accelerate your career and help you reach your full potential


**Discover Life at Nexi**
 We’re an international team of 10,000+ people across 25 countries, united by shared ambition and a passion for innovation. Learn more about our culture, Values, and how we’re shaping the future of digital payments. Visit our Life at Nexi page.
   

  

**Diversity and Inclusion at Nexi**
 We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer: together, we succeed by embracing our differences and creating a future where everyone can thrive.
   

  

**Your Next Step Starts Here**
 If this opportunity excites you, we’d love to hear your story. Submit your application today, and let’s shape the future of digital payments together!
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**QUALIFICATIONS**
**About Us**
 Are you interested in joining one of Europe's leading PayTech companies?
   

  

 Do you want to be part of a diverse team, collaborating with colleagues from across Europe? If so, you're in the right place!

title: Affärsförvaltare trafikinformation
description:
Nu söker vi dig som vill ta plats i en affärsdriven och strategisk roll där du får vara med och utveckla några av Trafikförvaltningens största och mest betydelsefulla avtal. Här arbetar vi nära våra leverantörer för att säkerställa en robust, pålitlig och störningsfri pendeltågs- och lokalbanetrafik – varje dag, för hundratusentals resenärer. Vill du vara med och skapa värde i miljardaffärer och samtidigt utveckla framtidens kollektivtrafik? Då kan detta vara din nästa utmaning.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Hos oss på trafikförvaltningen får du jobba med starka varumärken som SL, Waxholmsbolaget, Färdtjänst i Region Stockholm och Spårvägsmuseet.
   

  

 Tillsammans ansvarar vi för halva Sveriges kollektivtrafik och vi har höga ambitioner. Vi utvecklar en av världens mest hållbara och attraktiva kollektivtrafik. Och vi jobbar dagligen med att minska vår miljöpåverkan, öka social hållbarhet och ansvarfullt förvalta våra gemensamma medel. Utan oss stannar Stockholm.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som Affärsförvaltare inom trafikinformation får du en roll med tydlig påverkan på helheten. Du arbetar i skärningspunkten mellan affär, leverantörsstyrning och samhällsuppdrag, där dina beslut bidrar till att hundratusentals resenärer får en trygg, smidig och pålitlig resa varje dag.
   

  

 Rollen är unik i sin kombination av strategiskt ansvar och nära samarbete med både interna och externa aktörer. Här får du vara med och utveckla långsiktiga affärsrelationer, driva förbättringar i stora avtal och forma hur trafikinformationen i regionens kollektivtrafik ska fungera.
   

  

**Några exempel på arbetsuppgifter:**
* Följa upp att verksamheten löper enligt avtal, genom servicenivåer och leveranser inom Kundservice området som upphandlade trafikutövare ska upprätthålla
* Ansvara för beställningar till leverantör gällande kundserviceverksamheten utöver fastställd bemanning
* Att initialt arbeta inom teamet för pendeltåg där Affärsområdeschefen leder och fördelar arbetet, men även att arbeta med övriga avtal inom sektion Spår
* Delta aktivt i interna och externa dialoger gällande kundserviceområdet
* Samarbeta internt inom Trafikförvaltningen med sektioner ansvariga för t ex fastighetsförvaltning, infrastruktur, fordonsförvaltning, säkerhet, trygghet och resenärsservice
* Samarbeta internt och externt inom områden trafikinformation, där Trafikverket är en viktig samarbetspartner, intäktssäkring och IT systemforum för dessa områden.


 Hos oss på Sektion Spår får du en central roll där resenären alltid står i fokus. Tillsammans med engagerade kollegor, kommuner, staten och privata aktörer driver du affärerna framåt och bidrar till lösningar som påverkar hela samhället.
   

  

**För att trivas och lyckas i rollen behöver du:**
 Ha en personlig mognad, god samarbetsförmåga och ett strukturerat arbetssätt som skapar trygghet i komplexa frågor. Du trivs i en samordnande roll där du håller ihop helheten och är flexibel när situationen kräver det.
   

  

 Resenärens behov driver ditt arbete och du har lätt för att få organisationen med dig. Eftersom affärsrelationerna är långsiktiga blir ditt relationsbyggande särskilt viktigt. Med tydlig målstyrning och ett naturligt resultatansvar ser du till att affären utvecklas åt rätt håll.
   

  

**Krav:**
* Några års arbetslivserfarenhet inom kundservicearbete eller trafikinformation
* Goda kunskaper i svenska språket, både muntligt och skriftligt.


**Det är meriterande om du har:**
* Högskoleutbildning inom ekonomi, juridik eller IT
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av offentlig förvaltning eller myndighet
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av att arbeta med avtalsuppföljning
* Arbetslivserfarenhet inom IT eller transportverksamhet
* Kunskap inom trafikinformationssystem.


**Det här erbjuder vi dig**
 På trafikförvaltningen har du möjlighet att växa och utvecklas för ett helt yrkesliv. Här kan du vara expert och fokusera på ditt sakområde. Samtidigt som du jobbar i ett lag och i en organisation med stor bredd. Det finns stora möjligheter att röra sig mellan olika roller och uppgifter. Du har utrymme att forma din egen karriärväg och stärka både din personliga och professionella utveckling i en spännande och varierad miljö!
   

  

 Vi är en välkomnande och öppen arbetsplats där vi stöttar och hjälper varandra. Vi vet att nyckeln för att vi ska klara vårt uppdrag – är medarbetare som trivs, mår bra och kan utvecklas på jobbet. Därför lägger vi stor vikt vid att säkerställa hållbarhet i vårt arbetssätt, bland annat genom att erbjuda flexibilitet i vardagen och hybridarbete när möjlighet finns.
   

  

 Årligen erbjuds hälsoundersökning och friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 kr. Hälsospåret, vår friskvårdssatsning, innehåller en rad olika hälsofrämjande aktiviteter. SL-kort är en annan uppskattad förmån hos oss. Läs mer om våra förmåner här.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
 Du ansöker med CV via vår hemsida, vi har inte möjlighet att ta emot ansökan via e-post. För att säkra objektiva bedömningar använder vi tester i samband med urval. Om du har några frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Mikael Danielsson, tfn 070-786 32 78. För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta rekryterare Jannica Chinos, tfn 070-786 36 74.
   

  

 Ansök redan i dag eftersom intervjuer kan ske löpande. Sista ansökningsdag är
 **9 december** 
 . Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Grundutredning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan komma att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas. Vissa tjänster ställer krav på svenskt medborgarskap samt omfattas av en säkerhetsprövningsintervju med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).
   

  

 Provanställning kan komma att tillämpas och eventuella arbetsprov kan bli aktuella för tjänsten.
   

  

**Webb och sociala medier**
 För mer information om hur det är att jobba hos oss, besök vår karriärsida. Du hittar oss också på LinkedIn.
   

  

 Nyckelord: avtalsuppföljning, kundservice, trafikinformation, relationsbyggande, målstyrning
   

  

 Vi är stolta samhällsutvecklare. Med kompetens och engagemang tar vi Stockholm och kollektivtrafiken framåt. Vi ansvarar för SL, Waxholmsbolaget, Färdtjänsten och Spårvägsmuseet och tillsammans utvecklar vi en trygg, attraktiv och tillgänglig kollektivtrafik för nära 900 000 resenärer. Följ med oss på resan!
   

  

 Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen. Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 % | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/7215 | Kontakt: Mikael Danielsson tfn070-7863278, Jannica Chinos tfn070-7863674, | Facklig företrädare: Camilla Nyberg, Akavia 08-12331847, Marita Lönnroth, Vision 08-12333992, Thérèse Juvall, Akademikerförbundet SSR 08-12313942, Amir Sokolović, Sveriges ingenjörer 08-12333706, | Publicerat: 2025-11-18 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-12-09

title: Senior People Operations Specialist
description:
*At* 
***Norrin***
*, we’re shaping the era of Enterprise Intelligence. Our vision is to transform business productivity through data & AI by creating solutions that deliver measurable impact. As a Microsoft technology partner, we are at the forefront of reshaping how businesses operate across the Nordics. What defines us is deep technical expertise, a creative engineering mindset, and a people-first culture. You’ll have the chance to grow in a direction that matters to you while building solutions that make a real difference. With a strong presence in Finland and growing operations in Sweden, the United States, Thailand and Vietnam, we continue to expand our Nordic roots internationally. Most recently, Swedish company* 
***Bizone***
*joined the Norrin Group, further strengthening our presence across the Nordics.*
 As our international footprint grows, we’re looking for a
 **Senior People Operations Specialist** 
 to strengthen our People Operations team. Based in Stockholm, you’ll take ownership of coordinating and developing HR operations across Sweden, Thailand, and Vietnam, ensuring that our people processes are efficient, compliant, and reflect Norrin’s people-first values. You’ll report directly to our Chief People Officer and work closely with business stakeholders across locations, as well as the People Operations team in Finland. Together, we make sure every Norrin employee has an inclusive, supportive, and connected people experience, no matter where they work from.
   

  

 🧩
 **What you’ll do**
* Coordinate and oversee HR operations across Sweden, Thailand, and Vietnam
* Manage relationships with local payroll partners
* Support the harmonization of contracts, benefits, and policies across entities
* Ensure accurate and compliant HR documentation, reporting, and data management
* Oversee onboarding logistics and employee lifecycle processes for new hires
* Work closely with leadership to guide on HR-related matters and support employees with HR topics and questions
* Contribute to international People Ops projects and process development together with the CPO
* Provide operational support in recruitment coordination and office-related matters when needed


 🌱
 **Why Norrin?** 
  

  

* People-first culture: A workplace where you can be yourself. Our culture is built on openness, equality, and mutual respect
* Flexible working model: Our hybrid model offers the best of both worlds, flexibility in your daily life and in-person collaboration when it moves things forward
* Fair compensation: A competitive salary that reflects your skills and experience
* Grow with us: We encourage continuous learning and development in a direction that matters to you


**✨ What We Value**
* 4-5 years of experience in HR or People Operations, preferably in a multi-country setup
* Strong understanding of Swedish employment law and collective agreements
* Experience managing payroll and HR vendor relationships across countries
* Ability to advise leaders and employees on HR practices, policies, and compliance
* Highly organized, proactive, and detail-oriented, with a solution-driven mindset
* Comfortable working independently while collaborating across time zones and cultures
* Strong communications skills and fluency in both English and Swedish


**🍀 What’s a Plus (but Not Required)**
* Familiarity with HR operations, employment practices, and/or cultural contexts in the APAC region


**📩 Could this be your next opportunity?**
 We’re excited to hear from you! Applications are reviewed continuously, and we’ll move forward once we find the right match. If this sounds like a good fit, don’t wait too long to apply.

title: Industry Architect - Life Sciences
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*
 Job Category
   

  

 Sales
   

  

 Job Details
   

  

**About Salesforce**
 Salesforce is the #1 AI CRM, where humans with agents drive customer success together. Here, ambition meets action. Tech meets trust. And innovation isn’t a buzzword — it’s a way of life. The world of work as we know it is changing and we're looking for Trailblazers who are passionate about bettering business and the world through AI, driving innovation, and keeping Salesforce's core values at the heart of it all.
   

  

 Ready to level-up your career at the company leading workforce transformation in the agentic era? You’re in the right place! Agentforce is the future of AI, and you are the future of Salesforce.
   

  

**Industry Architect, Life Sciences**
 Salesforce is transforming how Life Sciences organizations deliver therapies and support patients. With Agentforce Life Sciences, we combine deep industry expertise with the scalability of the Salesforce platform to enable compliant, customer-centric solutions across Pharma, Biotech, and MedTech.
   

  

 We are seeking a
 **Life Sciences Industry Architect** 
 who can combine technical excellence, regulatory awareness, and industry depth to design robust solutions that drive trust and adoption across the life sciences value chain.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Architecture Leadership
+ Serve as the technical authority for Agentforce Life Sciences implementations across Northern Europe.
+ Define reference architectures that integrate Salesforce core and Agentforce Life Sciences capabilities with partner and ISV solutions.
+ Ensure solutions meet compliance, security, and data integrity requirements (e.g., GxP validation, 21 CFR Part 11).

* Solution Design & Delivery
+ Lead end-to-end architecture design, from discovery to blueprinting to hand-off into implementation.
+ Provide technical oversight on proof-of-concepts, pilots, and early implementations.
+ Partner with customers’ IT and enterprise architects to align Salesforce within broader enterprise architectures.

* Compliance & Validation
+ Guide customers through validation strategies for regulated systems on Salesforce.
+ Ensure design patterns support auditability, traceability, and compliance documentation.
+ Collaborate with security and regulatory experts to address regional regulatory requirements (EMA, GDPR, local data residency).

* Enablement & Advisory
+ Coach Solution Engineers and Account Teams on technical best practices and solution positioning.
+ Build technical enablement materials for field teams to accelerate adoption of Agentforce Life Sciences.
+ Act as a trusted advisor to customers’ technical leadership.


**What We’re Looking For**
**Knowledge & Expertise**
* Deep expertise in life sciences processes across commercial, medical, and R&D functions.
* Strong Salesforce platform and Life Science architectural knowledge.
* Understanding of enterprise integration patterns, APIs, and data orchestration.
* In-depth knowledge of regulatory requirements impacting life sciences IT systems (GxP, validation, audit, privacy).


**Skills**
* Strong architecture design and solution blueprinting skills.
* Technical gravitas in engaging with CIOs, CTOs, and enterprise architects.
* Ability to balance compliance and scalability in solution designs.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.


**Experience**
* 8–10+ years of enterprise architecture or solution architecture experience.
* Hands-on experience designing validated solutions in Pharma/MedTech.
* Track record of leading complex, multi-stakeholder technology programs.
* Exposure to ISVs and partner ecosystems supporting Life Sciences.


**Why Join Salesforce?**
* Innovative Culture: Be part of a company that's reshaping the future with advanced AI models and cloud solutions
* Global Impact: Contribute to products that are transforming industries worldwide
* Career Growth: Access to professional development opportunities, mentorship programs, and a clear path for advancement
* Benefits & Perks Check out our benefits site which explains our various benefits, including well-being reimbursement, generous parental leave, adoption assistance, fertility benefits, and more


 Unleash Your Potential
   

  

 When you join Salesforce, you’ll be limitless in all areas of your life. Our benefits and resources support you to find balance and
 *be your best* 
 , and our AI agents accelerate your impact so you can
 *do your best* 
 . Together, we’ll bring the power of Agentforce to organizations of all sizes and deliver amazing experiences that customers love. Apply today to not only shape the future — but to redefine what’s possible — for yourself, for AI, and the world.
   

  

 Accommodations
   

  

 If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.
   

  

 Posting Statement
   

  

 Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that’s inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. The same goes for compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, reduction in workforce, recall, training, and education.

title: Senior Business Developer
description:
**Senior Business Developer (Swedish speaking)** 




 Are you interested in helping the most ambitious companies grow through organic marketing via Google and ChatGPT, and are you motivated about sales and commercial analysis?
 



  





**About Us** 




 Bonzer is a specialized SEO (Search Engine Optimization) agency helping businesses grow their online presence across Google and AI search platforms like ChatGPT and Copilot. We’re experts in tailoring organic growth strategies that combine strong SEO fundamentals with the latest developments in search and AI technology - always aligned with each client’s unique goals and ambitions. Bonzer consists of around 50 passionate employees across Copenhagen, Stockholm and Oslo. For this role we are looking for someone to join us at our office in the heart of Stockholm.
 



  





**The Role** 




 As a Senior Business Developer for our Swedish department you will play a key role in realizing our sales targets within the market. This involves meetings with Swedish companies to assess if there is a match between our specialized approach to SEO and their ambitions. Leads come through our various channels, so much of the daily work will be inbound. Companies reach out to us to understand their potential in working with SEO. We offer a free analysis of how they are currently performing across classic search engines and modern AI search interfaces, how their competitors are doing, and much more. We then review the analysis with the company in a meeting, showing them their current status as well as a forecast of what is possible for their case. As a Senior Business Developer at Bonzer, your success will come from continuously building strong relationships, achieving your monthly revenue target, and creating sustainable solutions for all clients, regardless of size.
 



  





**On a daily basis, you will:** 



* Hold meetings with companies that reach out to us, present our material and analysis work, pitch our strategic proposal, and explain why they should choose Bonzer as their partner if we see a match.
* Handle both inbound and outbound meeting booking (you shall also be comfortable with making outbound calls when necessary).
* Analyze companies using our tools and data, focusing on their current errors, challenges, untapped potential, traffic forecast, and much more.
* Plan and conduct follow-up meetings, establishing the scope and framework of the strategy, and overall master pipeline management.
* Ensure a smooth and sustainable onboarding process for the client
* Report to our global CCO and be co-responsible for our new added revenue targets for the Swedish market.



  





**Traits We Value** 



* Has experience with sales, preferably B2B.
* Has experience with meeting booking and activity KPIs.
* Is outgoing, loyal, and naturally inclined to build relationships.
* Is independent, proactive, and enjoys a steep learning curve.
* Is analytical and has a critical mindset.
* Works in a structured way and does not compromise on the quality of your work.
* Has experience and knowledge in B2B account management (CRM systems).
* Is familiar with digital marketing, has a digital flair, and is accustomed to working with complex digital applications.
* The role requires fluent Swedish in both speaking and writing.



  





**Why You'll Love It Here** 



* Gain valuable insight and experience in digital marketing, branding and SEO.
* Gain valuable insight and experience in the commercial core of a fast growing company.
* Work closely with experienced professionals in the industry and learn all you need to know about B2B sales through our acknowledged sales framework.
* Enjoy flexible working hours to maintain a healthy work-life balance.
* Be part of an international company with a startup atmosphere in Stockholm.
* Join a passionate team with great vibes, Friday bars, and company events.



  





**Ready to Join Us?** 




 If you're excited about the Senior Business Developer role at Bonzer, upload your CV and a brief motivation. We'll reach out if we see a potential match and set up an introductory interview with our team.
 



  





 We can't wait to hear from you!
 



  





 Best,
 



 Team Bonzer

title: Master Thesis, 30 HP: Lead-time data quality for ramping up in an Engineer to Order environment – Securing and maintaining consistently high data quality
description:
Are you a student eager to apply your theoretical knowledge and fresh perspectives to real-world challenges? At Saab, we believe that innovation thrives on new ideas, and your master thesis project could be the spark that ignites our next technological breakthrough.
   

  

*Your role*
 We recognize the immense value that students bring to our company. Your academic rigor, combined with your enthusiasm for cutting-edge technology, allows you to approach problems with a unique and insightful lens. At Saab, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate with experienced engineers and specialists, gaining invaluable practical experience while making a tangible contribution to our growth and development.
   

  

**Background**
 Saab is currently in a situation of extreme growth of the business. The division Naval Combat Systems under Saab Surveillance is expanding the production and the production mode is intended to go from an Engineer to Order environment to eventually go to Make to Stock production with a big increase in production volume. An Engineer to Order environment that is rapidly changing creates issues within a lot of different functions of the organization. One of those functions is the Saab Production Planning function, which deals with the operational and long-term production planning in the business using an MRP/CRP methodology. A key aspect of making MRP function is accurate and reliable lead-times within the production. Given the current state of the business, this is both difficult and critical.
   

  

**Description Of The Master Thesis**
 This Master Thesis aims at examining how to secure, consistently update and maintain a high level of data quality for production lead-times during a massive ramp-up and shift of production modes in the business. To achieve this, you might take a mixed methods approach, both analyzing the quantitative data of lead-times per product and interviewing production engineers, designers, production staff, production planners and several more.
   

  

*Your profile*
 This Master Thesis is suitable for 1 to 2 students. You are at the end of your production, industrial management or supply-chain related education (either as a civilingenjör or as a free-standing master program) and about to start your Master Thesis work for 30 HP. Having taken any classes regarding MRP is a bonus but not a requirement, you will learn a lot during the thesis as well. Our working language is Swedish, so fluent Swedish is required.
   

  

 We provide the support and guidance you need to translate your theoretical knowledge into practical solutions. Join us and become a driving force behind Saab's technological advancements!
   

  

*This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.*
*What you will be a part of*
 Explore a wealth of possibilities. Take on challenges, create smart inventions, and grow beyond. This is a place for curious minds, brave pioneers, and everyone in between. Together, we achieve the extraordinary, each bringing our unique perspectives. Your part matters.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 25,500 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
   

  

**Last application day**
 31-10-2025
   

  

**Contact information**
**Emilia Byström** 
 , Manager
   

  

 076-637 14 37
   

  

 emilia.bystrom@saabgroup.com
   

  

**Axel Andersson** 
 , Master Thesis Supervisor
   

  

 073-123 4567
   

  

 Axel.andersson1@saabgroup.com

title: Senior Consulting Engineer -Stockholm
description:
**About Neo4j**
 Neo4j is the leader in Graph Database & Analytics, helping organizations uncover hidden patterns and relationships across billions of data connections deeply, easily, and quickly. Customers use Neo4j to gain a deeper understanding of their business and reveal new ways of solving their most pressing problems. Over 84% of Fortune 100 companies use Neo4j, along with a vibrant community of 250,000+ developers, data scientists, and architects across the globe.
   

  

 At Neo4j, we’re proud to build the technology that powers breakthrough solutions for our customers. These solutions have helped NASA get to Mars two years earlier, broke the Panama Papers for the ICIJ, and are helping Transport for London to cut congestion by 10% and save $750M a year. Some of our other notable customers include Intuit, Lockheed Martin, Novartis, UBS, and Walmart.
   

  

 Neo4j experienced rapid growth this year as organizations looking to deploy generative AI (GenAI) recognized graph databases as essential for improving it’s accuracy, transparency, and explainability. Growth was further fueled by enterprise demand for Neo4j’s cloud offering and partnerships with leading cloud hyperscalers and ecosystem leaders. Learn more at neo4j.com and follow us on LinkedIn.
   

  

**Our Vision**
 At Neo4j, we have always strived to help the world make sense of data.
   

  

 As business, society and knowledge become increasingly connected, our technology promotes innovation by helping organizations to find and understand data relationships. We created, drive and lead the graph database category, and we’re disrupting how organizations leverage their data to innovate and stay competitive.
   

  

 THE ROLE
   

  

 Working with our customer’s engineering teams, you’ll lead and contribute to all phases of the Neo4j implementation within their projects, from inception to roll-out.
   

  

 Act as the Technical Subject Matter expert for short to long-term consulting engagements where you’ll work hands-on with the Neo4j products, provide expert advice and guidance, train and educate, and help prepare deployments for production roll-out.
   

  

 Develop solution architectures that address the technical requirements of our customer’s projects
   

  

 Design and build prototype solutions that demonstrate required functionality with Neo4j
   

  

 Help prepare solution proposals for our customer’s engineering and management teams that help address the overall project goals.
   

  

**Job Requirements**
 Extensive experience with database technologies and data modeling concepts (preferably using big data and/or analytics technologies)
   

  

 Minimum of 5+ years of experience designing and developing enterprise-class applications.
   

  

 Knowledgeable in the Java ecosystem
   

  

 Hands-on development experience using API’s, messaging and middleware
   

  

 Experience with complex data analysis and passionate about solving technical data problems
   

  

 Experience working in an agile environment and DevOps experience
   

  

 Experience in a consultative role, with complex, customer-facing projects
   

  

 Capable of mentoring and educating small groups
   

  

 Demonstrated ability to work independently or within a team environment.
   

  

 Comfortable with learning new technologies and development languages as needed
   

  

 Great listening skills and attention to detail
   

  

**Nice To Have**
 Industry vertical experience in Financial Services, Retail, or Telco
   

  

 Graph DB related experience i.e. with Neo4j, OrientDB, TitanDB or similar
   

  

 Familiarity with Couchbase, MongoDB, Marklogic, Teradata or similar
   

  

 Experience in Visualization (D3, Sigma.js, Linkurious, Sawyer)
   

  

**Qualifications**
 Bachelor Degree required
   

  

 Ability to work independently, self-directed, and remotely in a cross-functional organization
   

  

 5+ years working in a consultative capacity in a Professional Services Organization
   

  

 Able to travel on occasion, outside of the dedicated region

title: Rekryteringsansvarig
description:
Vi söker en erfaren rekryterare som vill vara med och bygga upp ett modernt, effektivt och resultatinriktat rekryteringsarbete hos oss på Sylog Stockholm.
   

  

 Sylog erbjuder kvalificerade konsulttjänster inom mjukvaruutveckling och test till några av Sveriges mest teknikintensiva företag. Vi arbetar med både enskilda specialister och hela teamleveranser inom utveckling, test, inbyggda system och projektledning. I Stockholm består vi av erfarna konsulter och ett dedikerat backoffice-team. Vårt fokus är långsiktighet, kvalitet och en trygg anställning för våra konsulter.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som rekryterare hos oss får du en nyckelroll i att hitta, attrahera och rekrytera IT-talanger inom mjukvaruutveckling och test. Du driver hela processen självständigt, från behovsanalys och search till intervjuer, urval och anställning, i nära samarbete med säljare, konsultchefer och regionchef. Du får stort mandat att påverka hur vi arbetar, och möjlighet att forma ett rekryteringsarbete med tydligt resultatfokus. Rollen passar dig som trivs med flera parallella uppdrag och snabbt kan anpassa dig efter verksamheten behov.
   

  

**Du kommer även att bidra strategiskt genom att**
* Utveckla och effektivisera våra rekryteringsprocesser
* Arbeta proaktivt för att säkra en stark kandidatpipeline
* Bygga långsiktiga relationer och stärka vårt arbetsgivarvarumärke


**Vi söker dig som**
* Har erfarenhet av rekrytering och search inom IT
* Är självständig och van att driva rekryteringsprocesser från start till mål
* Har pondus och förmåga att påverka och skapa resultat
* Är handlingskraftig, proaktiv och lösningsorienterad
* Trivs i ett högt tempo och motiveras av tydliga mål och samarbete
* Behärskar svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift


**Vi erbjuder**
* En roll med stort ansvar och frihet
* Möjligheten att bygga upp en robust rekryteringsfunktion
* En kultur med korta beslutsvägar och högt engagemang
* Placering på vårt kontor i Liljeholmen, Stockholm


 Vi behandlar ansökningar löpande, varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Bli en del av vårt IT-arkitekt-team på CGI
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Just nu söker vi en IT-arkitekt till en av våra kunder inom offentlig sektor i Stockholm. Du kommer att bli en del av vårt härliga arkitekt-team på CGI där vi jobbar i nära samarbete med bland annat affärskonsulter, applikationsexperter, utvecklare och andra arkitekter.
   

  

 I uppdraget kommer du att vara en nyckelperson som bidrar till att aktivt driva och ta fram efterfrågat material så som lösningsförslag och icke-funktionella krav för att kunna ta viktiga beslut inom både arkitektur och teknik.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Förutom offentlig sektor arbetar vi brett inom olika branscher och kunder, vilket också ger möjlighet för dig att utveckla dig själv och din kompetens.
   

  

 I dina framtida arbetsuppgifter ingår bland annat lösningsförslag och säkerställande av robust it-arkitektur. Men också förstudier, roadmaps samt modellering, metodutveckling och integrationer. Jobbet som IT-arkitekt är både brett och tvärfunktionellt och du stöttar kunden i både lösningar och genomförande.
   

  

 Du blir en del av ett härligt team konsulter med olika erfarenhetsnivå som alla delar ett brinnande intresse för arkitektur och lösningar. Vi gillar att samverka i en kreativ, positiv och energigivande miljö där samarbete, kontinuerligt lärande och att stötta varandra värderas högt i det dagliga arbetet.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* 5 års erfarenhet som IT-arkitekt
