title: Backend Engineer to Ramudden Global
description:
*Are you ready to take a key role in a global tech team? Shape impactful IoT systems and drive cloud innovation while making the world a safer place!* 




  





**About the job** 




 This is a direct recruitment, which means that the recruitment process takes place through Bravura and you are employed directly by Ramudden Global.
 



  





**About the company** 




 Ramudden Global is a leading provider of temporary traffic management (TTM) solutions for critical infrastructure projects. The company delivers a combination of TTM safety equipment rentals, digital technologies and specialized services across its operations.
 



 With more than 5,000 employees in 13 countries and annual revenues exceeding €1 billion, Ramudden Global's growth is driven by a clear mission:
 *to get people home safely every day* 
 . This mission shapes every part of the organisation's work and reflects a strong commitment to safety for employees, clients and the general public.
 



  





 The company promotes a culture of innovation and shared knowledge, encouraging the development of practical solutions and responsible governance. At its core, Ramudden Global seeks to be a caring and positive force for a safer world.
 



  





**Tasks and responsibilities** 




 As a Backend Engineer, you’ll be part of the Global Platform Team at Ramudden, building the cloud-based platform that powers their digital devices. You will be working with making sure that the platform connects different types of devices, manages their state changes, and integrates seamlessly with third-party services.
 



  





 In this role, you’ll be working in a cross-functional, agile setup together with colleagues specialized in both hardware and software. Your focus will be on designing and building scalable, reliable backend systems that sit at the core of the digital infrastructure. You will also get to take features from idea to production and be involved in both discovery and delivery through Dual Track Agile.
 



 You will be collaborating closely with other Software Engineers, Product Managers, designers, and Hardware Engineers to create innovative solutions, while also contributing to the standardization of Ramuddens design system and the technical best practices.
 



  





**Tech Stack** 




 • Backend: .NET 9.0, C#
 



 • Databases: PostgreSQL with PostGIS
 



 • Data & Analytics: Stitch, DBT, Snowflake, PowerBI
 



 • Cloud: Azure (Service Bus, Container Apps)
 



 • Architectural Patterns: Clean Architecture, CQRS, Domain-Driven Design, Repository Pattern, Event Driven Architecture (EDA)
 



 • DevOps: Docker, GitHub Actions, Infrastructure as Code (Bicep)
 



  





**Education, experience and personal characteristics** 




 • 3+ years of experience in backend development using object-oriented languages such as C#, Java or Kotlin
 



 • Experience in automated testing, including unit, integration and API tests
 



 • Proficient in working with relational databases and SQL, experience with PostgreSQL is preferred
 



 • Fluent in Swedish and English, both written and spoken
 



  





**It´s a plus if you have** 




 • Experience with .NET framework
 



 • Experience working with IoT platforms or device management systems
 



 • Familiarity with PostGIS or other geospatial database extensions
 



  





 We are looking for someone who is self-driven and thrives on taking ownership in their work. You are not only passionate about creating scalable and reliable solutions but also bring strong personal leadership to everything you do.
 



  





 You work independently and proactively, yet understand the value of collaboration and clear communication. You are a team player who listens actively, gives and receives feedback with openness, and contributes to a positive and solution-focused team culture.
 



  





 Being unafraid to challenge assumptions and take initiative comes naturally to you. You take responsibility for your work, are not afraid to ask questions, and always strive to move the team and the product forward.
 



  





**Other information** 




 Start: Upon agreement
 



 Location: Stockholm
 



 Salary: Upon agreement
 



  





 We use a competency-based methodology in all our recruitment processes to ensure impartial selection. We also work with continuous selection, which means that we take down the advertisement when enough candidates have applied. If you are suitable for the position, we will contact you for an initial telephone interview.
 



  





 Regardless of whether you proceed in the process or not, you will receive feedback on your application.
 



  





 Do you have any questions? Please get in touch!
 



  





 📧 info@bravura.se
 



 📞 010-171 47 10
 



  





 We recommend that you submit your application immediately as we make a continuous selection.
 



  





 Welcome with your application!

title: HVDC Project Supplier Quality Inspector
description:
**Location:**

Ludvika, Dalarna County, Sweden
**Job ID:**

R0112745
**Date Posted:**

2025-11-18
**Company Name:**

HITACHI ENERGY SWEDEN AB
**Profession (Job Category):**

Quality Management
**Job Schedule:**

Full time
**Remote:**

No
**Job Description:**

**The Opportunity**

HVDC (High Voltage Direct Current) is a product group in Hitachi, which develops, manufactures and sells DC transmission systems on a global market. HVDC technology is used to transmit electricity over long distances and for power transmission via submarine cables. It is also used to connect power systems.


We are now hiring a Project Supplier Quality Inspector to HVDC Sweden, a business line within Hitachi. As Project Supplier Quality Inspector you have a key role in the project by being responsible to perform inspections at Suppliers to ensure the equipment is manufactured according to the requirements. Work tasks are split between operational site visits to suppliers, performing inspections, and traveling. Strategic tasks as part of the department and different project teams for you to give input, report on findings, and work with other stakeholders both internal and external in preparation of and feedback about inspections.


We are interested to learn more about you and what you can contribute with so don’t hesitate to apply even though you don’t meet all requirements. A team with great cooperation and with diverse backgrounds is waiting for you to join!


**How you’ll make an impact**

* Understand the contract, specifications, budget, scope and other relevant project documentation related to the different types of equipment in the scope of the HVDC stations.
* Participate and be a decisive team player in the coordination meetings where inspections are distributed within the Project Supplier Quality Inspector.
* Perform inspections in line with the time schedule and the different contractual milestones, producing the inspection reports according to the project requirements.
* You care about delivering quality to the Customer and are not afraid to highlight the Customer's needs to the supplier to provide the best solution to the Customer.
* Identify, estimate and report cost savings or cost avoidance based on outcome of the inspections.
* Engage and support the stakeholders in the usage of the Project Completion System (PCS) database for tracking supplier inspections and punch items.
* Ensure all relevant documentation and punch items are correctly registered in the PCS including those identified during the Factory Acceptance Tests.
* Supervise the Suppliers in the completion of the Inspection and Test Records and punch items on a regular basis based on the scope.
* Raise deviations when deemed relevant based on punches.
* Takes part in completions meetings with customer, supplier, and Hitachi personnel and provide leadership on the actions assigned.

**Your background**

* Technical / Engineering / Quality management education or equivalent professional experience
* HVDC station equipment scope understanding a bonus
* Minimum 3+ years’ experience in a similar role.
* Knowledge and experience of working with a PCS such as PIMS and ProCoSys, or alternatively another similar inspection management software e.g., BIM 360 Field, Aconex Field, etc.
* Proficient oral and written communication skills including technical documentation and reporting
* Sensitive to Customer and project team needs and can develop a sustainable relationship to all involved stakeholders through clear communication, influencing and coordination
* English fluency (written + spoken)
* Availability to travel

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**More about us**

Are you ready for a new exciting challenge? Does the above description sound like you? Welcome to apply! Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so don’t delay – apply today!


Recruiting Manager Daniel Martinez, daniel.martinez@hitachienergy.com will be happy to answer your questions regarding this position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 29 86; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43. All other questions should be directed to Talent Partner Michael Blomberg Michael.blomberg@hitachienergy.com


**Qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Hitachi Energy career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by completing a** **general inquiry form** **on our website. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**This is solely for job seekers with disabilities requiring accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Messages left for other purposes will not receive a response.**
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

title: Robotics Engineer Engage Studios (Gothenburg)
description:
About Engage Studios
  
Engage Studios works at the intersection of design, visualization, and robotics.
  
We build autonomous robots for demanding environments, using ROS2/Nav2, NVIDIA-class compute, LiDAR, and custom electronics.
  
The Role
  
  

**Full-time, on-site in Gothenburg, with some travel. You will:**  

Develop and improve our ROS2/Nav2 navigation stack (Python/C++)
  
Integrate sensors, hub motors, LiDAR, and electronics
  
Debug and optimize systems in the lab and in the field
  
Work across the stack – from low-level hardware to high-level autonomy
  
Collaborate with a small, cross-disciplinary engineering and design team
  
  

Who are you
  
M.Sc. in Robotics, Mechatronics, Electrical, Mechanical, CS, or similar
  
Hands-on robotics experience (work experience)
  
Solid Python and C++ skills
  
ROS2/Nav2 experience or strong drive to learn fast
  
Comfortable with both hardware and software
  
Fluent in English
  
Ready to travel for tests and deployments
  
  

Why Engage?
  
You’ll be a core engineer shaping our robotics roadmap, working with cutting-edge tools and seeing your robots operate in real environments – not just on a lab bench.

title: Engine Control Engineer
description:
The Engine Control team is a core part of the Powertrain Software function within Koenigsegg's Software & Electronics Department, nestled in the heart of R&D. As a Powertrain Software Engineer focused on Engine Control, you will play a vital role in pushing the boundaries of what's possible in vehicle performance.Your focus will be developing, testing, and calibrating engine control software in C, enabling everything from core functionality and base calibration to torque models and drivability enhancements. Every day, you will work closely with cross-functional teams, driving innovation and precision in our collaborative, fast-paced environments.

**What you will do:**


* Build, improve, and fine-tune various engine control software functions
* Conduct precise calibrations across multiple engine control areas to ensure minimum emissions and maximum performance and reliability
* Ensure top-tier software quality by testing on both test benches and tracks, refining maturity with every iteration



Skills & Requirements


To be successful in this role, you should be a skilled troubleshooter, comfortable navigating both electrical and mechanical automotive systems. You have an analytical mind-set and can see the broader impacts of your work across the entire vehicle - not just one subsystem. You also thrive in a dynamic, cross-functional environment where success is built on collaboration and team-work.


* **Degree in** **Engineering**, ideally with an automotive profile/focus.
* Previous work in **Automotive Industry**, Formula Student, FSAE, Motorsport or similar automotive contexts.
* 2+ years of experience in **engine software development.**
* Proficient in **C/C++.**



Great Place to Work


Opportunity to impact a growing company


Work alongside world-class talent


Flexible work schedules + Culture of collaboration


Long track record of success and profitability


Engaging and sharing work environment


Quick decision making, flat hierarchy


About the company


Koenigsegg is most known for building some of the fastest cars in the world; with almost all of our megacar technologies that are patented and made in-house by our almost 500 world-class technicians, engineers, sourcing experts, production craftsmen, and communicators.


What we’ve created is a unique proving ground of engineering creativity that makes use of our breakthrough megacar development and legacy to push the boundaries of sustainable mobility technology.



So, what’s next?


We are on a universe-denting mission to develop the next generation of breakthrough tech and products. We are looking for outstanding, impactful, and authentic individuals to grow with us. Our ambitions are inspiring but will push the limits of what is possible – requiring one to work efficiently amid our cross-functional teams to execute at high-quality levels.


**The goal is clear: innovate and transform.**

title: Verification & Validation Engineer - Automotive
description:
**Företagsbeskrivning**  

Letar du efter ett företag som erbjuder varierande uppdrag och ger dig chansen att arbeta med innovation och ny teknik? Hos oss på SEGULA Technologies får du möjlighet att arbeta med spännande projekt och vara med och forma den digitala domänen samtidigt som du får stöd mot din drömkarriär. Kompetensutveckling är en stor del av SEGULA Technologies DNA och vi letar alltid efter nya, geniala och djärva talanger. Låter det här spännande? Följ med oss på vår resa i ett snabbväxande internationellt företag.

 **Jobbeskrivning** **Till vårt Verification & Validation-team på Segula söker vi en ny konsult som vill följa med på vår resa.**  

Vi söker en senior ingenjör med Automotive-erfarenhet. Som primärt kommer att jobba med teststruktur, kravhantering, skapa testfall och utföra manuell testing.

**Ansvarsområde:**

* Verifiera kompletta system och säkerställ krav och spårbarhet med hjälp av SystemWeaver.
* Definiera och automatisera test cases där det är möjligt.
* Utföra tester på HIL rigs och fordon; analysera resultat och rapportera.
* Genomföra cybersecurity penetration tester och audits.
* Delar du kan komma få arbeta med: Verifiering, E2E functions, Cybersecurity, Charging & Traction Voltage Systems.

 **Kvalifikationer** **Krav**

* SystemWeaver för kravhantering och spårbarhet.
* Vector tools: CANalyzer, CANoe.
* Erfarenhet av automotive embedded software testing och integration.
* Stark analytisk förmåga och problemlösningsförmåga.
* Automotive-bakgrund.
* Erfarenhet av Komplettvagnstestning.

**Meriterande:**

* Kunskap om cybersecurity pen-testing .
* C-körkort.
* Programming: Python, CAPL

  

**Ytterligare information** **Vad vi erbjuder**

* Trygga anställnings- och arbetsvillkor enligt svensk arbetsrätt
* Konkurrenskraftig lön och förmånspaket
* Uppdrag med Segulas uppskattade kunder, ledande företag inom sitt område
* Chansen att använda din kompetens för att göra verklig skillnad för framtiden samtidigt som du har ett dedikerat konsultföretag som ditt stöd
* Bli en del av ett växande nätverk av skickliga ingenjörer
* Nära relation med din chef som stöttar dig i din karriärutveckling


För att trivas i den här rollen ser vi att du tycker om att samarbeta och att du är proaktiv och tar initiativ. För att söka den här tjänsten måste du ha ett giltigt arbetsvisum inom Europeiska unionen. Vi värnar om mångfald och jämställdhet och lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. Vi rekryterar löpande, så välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!
company_description: SEGULA is a gobal engineering group helping boost competitiveness within all of the major industrial sectors.

title: Test Engineer
description:
At Tata Technologies we make product development dreams a reality by designing, engineering and validating the products of tomorrow for the world’s leading manufacturers. Due to our continued growth, we are now recruiting for a Test Engineer experienced in HIL to strengthen our team in Gothenburg.
  
  

**Role Overview:**  

As a Hardware-in-the-Loop (HIL) Engineer, you will join a collaborative team focused on designing, developing, and maintaining electrical HIL rigs at both component and domain levels. These rigs enable early-stage integration and verification of hardware and software by simulating real vehicle environments using advanced Vector tools. Your work ensures that HIL systems evolve to support emerging technologies such as electrification and autonomous driving.
  
You will contribute to continuous improvements in test automation, simulation models, and integration strategies, gaining broad exposure to vehicle systems and electrical architectures while driving innovation in automated testing and continuous integration.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Lead the design, development, and maintenance of HIL rigs.
  
Drive integration efforts across multiple product domains.
  
Commission and validate HIL test objects.
  
Diagnose and resolve hardware issues, including harnesses and simulations.
  
Manage ECU updates and component configurations on HIL rigs.
  
Develop network simulations (Gateways, signal manipulation, etc.).
  
Support manual software downloads for core ECUs.
  
  

**Profile:**  

You are a problem-solver with a collaborative mindset, capable of managing multiple tasks in parallel. You value quality, continuous improvement, and innovative approaches to processes and methods.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in Electronics, Mechatronics, Physics, or similar.
  
10+ years of relevant experience.
  
  

**Skills & Expertise:**  

Strong background in electronic systems development (HW & SW).
  
Hands-on experience with HIL and automated test systems using Vector tools.
  
Proficiency in Python and CAPL for scripting and automation.
  
Deep understanding of automotive communication protocols (CAN, LIN, Ethernet).
  
Skilled in CANoe for simulation and data analysis.
  
  

**Familiarity with Vector hardware components:**  

VT System modules (VT RT Modules, VT cards)
  
RT Rack and compatible I/O boards
  
Vector Network Interface cards
  
Power supply units and control systems
  
  

**Preferred:**  

Experience with domains like Doors, Sunroof, and Trailer modules or experience with Exterior Lighting or Interior System domains.
  
  

**Tools:**  

CANoe, vTESTstudio
  
Vector VT Systems
  
Vector VT RT Modules
  
Vector RT Racks
  
CAPL
  
Python (C# is a plus)
  
  

If you are passionate about bringing innovation to the projects you work on then we would love to hear from you.
  
**Tata Technologies:** Engineering a better world.
  
Tata Technologies would like to thank all applicants for their interest, each application will be reviewed against the set criteria for the role. We would like to advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted. If you do not hear from us within 10 working days following the closing date it will mean that unfortunately your application has not been successful. We will however retain your details for any suitable future opportunities.

title: Project Manager Göteborgs Energy Systems AB
description:
Do you have experience as a Project Manager and want to lead international projects in the maritime industry? We are now looking for you to join us on our journey forward – towards smarter and more sustainable marine heating solutions. Read more about the role and the candidate profile below.
  
The Position As a Project Manager, you will be responsible for leading customized projects within marine heating systems from handover to final delivery. You will work closely with customers through ongoing follow-up and relationship building. Your role is to clarify project scope and requirements, while also managing planning and budgeting. You will design basic system layouts and drawings in AutoCAD LT. You will also specify equipment and coordinate engineering, procurement, and suppliers. Finally, you will ensure documentation and approvals are in place. Several projects will run in parallel, and your success depends on structure, precision, and attention to detail.
  
The position is based at our office in Gothenburg, with only occasional travel.
  
  

**Key responsibilities:**  

Maintain customer contact and follow-up throughout the project
  
Manage project budget and financial follow-up
  
Design systems and produce drawings (AutoCAD LT)
  
Specify equipment and support the procurement process
  
Coordinate internal and external resources and deliveries
  
Prepare and maintain project and delivery documentation
  
Report on progress and contribute to continuous improvement of workflows and processes
  
  

Our offer to you At GESAB, you will be part of an internationally oriented company where you are included and recognized as an important part of the team. Your ideas and ways of working can truly make a difference. We value well-being and balance, offering employment conditions covered by a collective agreement. This includes a health check-up every two years, a wellness allowance, and a bonus program. To strengthen our team spirit, we also enjoy a team breakfast every Wednesday. At GESAB, you are not just an employee – you are an important part of our journey forward. Your profile We are looking for a Project Manager who is structured and organized, with strong skills in planning, prioritizing, and managing projects efficiently. You are a team player who collaborates well with different stakeholders and contributes to a positive, solution-oriented work environment. At the same time, you are proactive and take initiative, driving the work forward by identifying needs, taking responsibility, and finding solutions.
  
The role requires that you are self-motivated, able to make decisions, and work in a focused and goal-oriented way even when entrusted with a high level of responsibility. You are also communicative and comfortable working with clients and partners in international environments, where English is often the main working language. To succeed in this role, you should have several years of technical project management experience, leading projects from start to completion.
  
Göteborgs Energy Systems GESAB designs and delivers complete heating systems and NOx reduction solutions. Our offering covers the full project scope – from concept studies, project planning, specifications, and P&IDs to class approval, construction drawings, and project-specific manuals. We are primarily focused on the maritime industry, serving a global customer base of shipyards, shipowners, and offshore operators. GESAB has subsidiaries in Germany and China, along with several branch offices worldwide.
  
Requirements
  
  

Technical engineering degree
  
Experience in project management
  
Some experience in a similar role
  
Proficiency in English, both spoken and written
  
Knowledge of AutoCAD LT is an advantage
  
  

Preferred qualification
  
  

Experience from the energy and marine industry
  
Background as an HVAC engineer
  
PLC/software competence
  
Swedish language skills
  
  

We look forward to receiving your application! Please note that we review applications on an ongoing basis, which means the position may be filled before the application deadline.
  
**Application deadline:** 2025-11-30
  
**Start date:** As soon as possible
  
**Position:** Full-time
  
**Location:** Gothenburg
  
Platsa is responsible for the recruitment process for this position. If employed, you will be hired directly by our client. For any questions, please contact the responsible recruiter:
  
Evelina Löfberg – evelina.lofberg@platsa.se

title: Cybersecurity Engineer
description:
**About Us**


At Consilium Safety Group, we don’t just build technology — we create solutions that protect people, assets, and the planet. As a global leader in fire and gas safety, we serve critical industries such as marine, energy, rail, and construction.


With over 100 years of expertise and 55 offices worldwide, we combine deep industry knowledge with cutting-edge innovation to redefine the future of SafetyTech. Backed by strong investors, we’re now entering an exciting transformation and growth journey — and we want you to be part of it.

**Your Mission**


As a Cybersecurity Engineer, you’ll play a key role in strengthening our products and development environments. You’ll work hands-on with SBOM management, vulnerability tracking, and cybersecurity governance to ensure our solutions meet the highest standards of safety and resilience.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**SBOM and Dependency Management**

* Maintain and operate the internal SBOM management platform (CycloneDX, SPDX).
* Collaborate with development teams to identify and remediate vulnerabilities.
* Integrate SBOM and vulnerability management tools into CI/CD pipelines (GitLab CI).

**Vulnerability and Threat Management**

* Support the Product Vulnerability Management (PVM) process: triage, assess, and track vulnerabilities.
* Support the creation of security advisories or patch notifications.
* Maintain internal vulnerability and risk databases, coordinating with stakeholders.
* Define and maintain component approval policies, including open-source license compliance and security evaluation.

**Cybersecurity Governance Support**

* Contribute to cybersecurity dashboards, audits, and metrics.
* Support Secure Development Lifecycle (SDL) activities such as threat modeling, code analysis, and reviews.
* Participate in continuous improvement of our Cybersecurity Management System (CSMS) and related procedures.

**Continuous Improvement**

* Adapt tools, processes, and workflows to evolving business and regulatory demands.

**Your Profile**

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Cybersecurity, or a related field.
* 3+ years of experience in software development or product cybersecurity engineering.
* Hands-on experience with Dependency-Track, CycloneDX, SPDX, or similar SBOM tools.
* Familiarity with vulnerability management workflows and secure development lifecycle (SDLC) practices.
* Experience integrating security into CI/CD pipelines (GitLab preferred).
* Knowledge of Linux and embedded systems is an advantage.
* Understanding of IEC 62443, ISO 27001, or Cyber Resilience Act (CRA) is a plus.

**Why Join Consilium Safety Group?**

* Work in a collaborative, international, and diverse environment.
* Contribute to technologies that protect lives and critical infrastructure.
* Competitive compensation and benefits package.
* Be part of a company that’s shaping the future of SafetyTech.

**Ready to Apply?**


If you're passionate about cybersecurity, innovation, and making a real-world impact, we’d love to hear from you.  

**Apply now** and join us on our journey to make the world a safer place.

**Want to Learn More?**


Hear from our CEO, **Philip Isell Lind af Hageby**, on our transformation journey:  

*Philip Isell Lind af Hageby, Consilium, en mästare på turnarounds* – Värdeskaparna | Podcast on Spotify

title: Senior Back-End Engineer (.Net)_LATAM
Backend Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Job Description**
* Help manage the fleet of dbt: ensure undisrupted operations (scheduling and execution), up-to-date functionalities and features.
* Help deliver an AI-assisted migration from BigQueryRunner (in-house SQL transformation and scheduling tool) to dbt, powered by Honk, client's agentic coding system.
* Contribute to building data verification loops (tests, lineage, contract checks) that enable agentic and safe migration from BQ Runner to dbt, as well as other changes to data pipelines.
* Help explore open-source and commercial SQL transformation options, as alternatives to dbt-core and perform light-weight technical evaluations and prototyping.


**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Fluent in Python, bash scripting, (Java)
* Deep knowledge of the modern analytics data stack (SQL, dbt or other tooling for data pipelines).
* Deep and multi-year knowledge of SQL-like languages and data warehouses like BigQuery.
* Experience with employing AI code assistants to increase own efficiency.
* Familiar with the principles of AI engineering (building products on top of foundational models)
* Hands on experience with agentic systems is a huge plus.


**Application deadline:** 
 25-11-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Golang Software Engineer
description:

 We are seeking exceptional Backend Product Engineers to help build the future of AI-enabled software creation. You will work across the full backend stack to develop the systems and features that power an AI platform used by millions of creators, builders, and teams worldwide.
 



 This is an opportunity to join a small, high-performing engineering team building generation-defining technology. We value ownership, velocity, and low-ego collaboration. If you care deeply about building meaningful products, moving fast, and pushing the boundaries of what’s possible with AI, we want to hear from you.
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 



* Build and scale the backend systems that power core product functionality
* Design, implement, and maintain backend services, APIs, and infrastructure components
* Own systems end-to-end — architecture, implementation, deployment, monitoring, iteration
* Work closely with frontend, ML, and product teams to turn ideas into robust, scalable features
* Influence backend architecture, engineering culture, and long-term technical strategy



  





**What We’re Looking For** 



* **5+ years of experience** 
 designing, building, and scaling backend systems in production
* Fluency in
 **Go, Rust, or similar backend languages** 
 , with strong API design skills

 **distributed systems, scalability, reliability, and performance**

**Tech Stack**

 React

title: Embedded developer and tester
description:
Scania's R&D department is transforming to become part of TRATON Group R&D. TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 We are looking for a skilled Embedded Developer and Tester to join our development team within the Departure Management area. This includes remote- heating, cooling and schedule charging for BEV and ICE. Our team is responsible for the backend solution enabling connected functions in the vehicle all the way to the cloud.
   

  

 You will play a key role in developing secure, adaptive, and cloud-connected embedded systems that enable advanced charging strategies in the TRATON brands – driving both customer value and sustainability.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll work hands-on with cutting-edge platforms such as Adaptive AUTOSAR and QNX, and contribute to the bridge between in-vehicle ECUs and the AWS cloud. You will collaborate closely with developers and engineers in a fast-paced environment focused on high performance, safety, and innovation.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Design, develop, and test embedded software components using C++ in an Adaptive AUTOSAR environment.
* Work on a QNX-based communication ECU, including inter-process communication, resource management, and integration with vehicle networks (CAN, SOME/IP, Ethernet).
* Contribute to the secure connection between embedded systems and AWS IoT services.
* Ensure robust testing and continuous integration for both embedded and cloud-linked systems.
* Collaborate in cross-functional Agile teams and contribute to continuous improvement of development and test processes.


**Who You Are**
* You have solid experience in embedded software development, particularly with C++ and preferably with Adaptive AUTOSAR in automotive environments.
* You’re comfortable working with QNX and automotive communication protocols such as CAN, SOME/IP, and Ethernet.
* You are curious about cloud integration and how in-vehicle software can connect to scalable backends.
* You are a collaborative and communicative team player, with excellent English skills and a proactive mindset.
* You take pride in delivering high-quality, reliable solutions.
* You are motivated by the impact of BEVs on sustainability and want to contribute to the electrified transport revolution.
* A truck driver’s license (C/CE) is considered a strong plus.


 We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – your unique experience and perspectives is valuable to us.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 We’re a tight-knit, high-performing team of four developers, working according to value-based SAFe agile principles. While delivery is always in focus, innovation and personal growth are never compromised.
   

  

 We combine embedded expertise with cloud capabilities to deliver safe, secure, and efficient charging solutions for BEV customers and departure management.
   

  

 Everyone takes ownership – and has each other’s back. We value trust, collaboration, and the freedom to explore and improve.
   

  

 Together with the other teams in our group, we form a key capability in the future of connected and electrified transport solutions.
   

  

 Within TRATON Group R&D, you are an important part of something bigger. Joining us means gaining access to the ins and outs of the entire transportation industry. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Being bigger also means being stronger. Together with our brands, we have the collective power to transform transportation.
   

  

**We Offer**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON Group R&D supports your career growth both locally and internationally. Benefits include wellness allowance, TRATON result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. We also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-11-27. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: Sofie Jalonen, Head of Connected Streaming Data SWE, sofie.jalonen@scania.com
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: QA Software Engineer
description:
Are you an experienced Quality Assurance professional ready to take on a new challenge? We are looking for a Senior Quality Assurance Engineer to join our team responsible for managing equipment through an online service. Your work will be key to help your team to deliver high quality applications as we continue to grow.
   

  

**Role And Responsibilities**
* Create and execute test plans based on product requirements and business needs.
* Provide visibility into software quality through metrics, dashboards, and reports.
* Drive the automation of manual tests and contribute to CI/CD pipeline improvements.
* Validate that all product requirements are thoroughly tested with high coverage.
* Coordinate and manage test data in multiple environments.
* Collaborate with developers, product managers, and other teams to define quality objectives.
* Work as part of the backend development team, helping to design, implement, and maintain backend features while ensuring testability, reliability, and performance


**Qualifications**
 To be successful in this role we believe that you have:
   

  

* 5+ years of experience in Quality Assurance and test automation or equivalent software development experience.
* Proven experience as a software developer (minimum 2 years), preferably with backend systems and APIs.
* Proficiency in Python, JavaScript, Java, or similar programming languages.
* Knowledge of test automation tools (e.g., Selenium, Cypress, Playwright) and CI/CD pipelines.
* Experience creating test plans and test cases in agile environments.
* Strong understanding of requirement analysis and end-to-end quality coverage.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Experience with agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, etc.).
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, etc.).
* ISTQB certification or equivalent qualification.


**Bonus Skills (optional)**
* Experience with performance testing tools (e.g., JMeter, LoadRunner).
* Experience with API testing tools (e.g., Postman, REST Assured, JMeter).
* Knowledge of security testing practices.


**Working at DeLaval**
 Our core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behavior. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three behaviors: Set Direction, Make Things Happen and One DeLaval.
   

  

 We Offer You a Workplace Like No Other, Where State-of-the-art Technology Goes Hand In Hand With Animal Welfare. DeLaval Is a Part Of The Tetra Laval Group Together With Tetra Pak And Sidel. In Addition, We Offer
   

  

* A secure employment and benefits from the collective agreement (occupational pension, work-related accident insurance, parental leave, reduction of working hours).
* Parental leave compensation (approx. 10 percent of the employee's monthly salary).
* Wellness contribution of 4 000 SEK/year.
* Private health insurance.
* Flexible working hours.


**Additional Information**
 This is a full-time permanent position based at DeLaval’s headquarters in Tumba, south of Stockholm. We offer a hybrid workplace model, allowing flexibility to work remotely; however, employees are expected to be in the office at least three days per week.
   

  

 We review applications ongoing. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact us.
   

  

**Contact**
 Hiring manager: Magnus Storbjörk, magnus.storbjork@delaval.com
   

  

 Recruiter: Agnes Edbom, agnes.edbom@delaval.com
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.
   

  

 Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group. See more at corporate.delaval.com

title: Vision Software Engineer
description:
**DeLaval Is Looking For a Experienced Computer Vision Engineer**
 There are lots of opportunities for smart vision applications on a modern dairy farm. Today we supervise the condition of the cows and even control robots in real-time via vision. Tomorrow, we plan to do even more. Clever vision solutions will help farmers around the world to run their operations in a more efficient and environmentally friendly way.
   

  

 We are now looking for an experienced Computer Vision Engineer for our Data Science & Vision Team. This is a job where you clearly can see how your code will help the end customer every day. A trip to a farm now and then will also give you a better understanding of the environment and the problems we have to solve.
   

  

**Main Tasks**
* Develop and maintain computer vision applications for the dairy industry
* Take part in Proof-of-Concept studies and innovation projects
* Evaluate new technologies and tools in the area of computer vision
* Continuously develop and refine our way of working with vision technology


**Qualifications**
* Master’s degree in Engineering Physics, Computer Science or similar
* Experience from working with product development in industrial companies
* C++ and OpenCV
* Computer Vision experience – preferrable both traditional- and model-based image processing
* Knowledge about cameras, optics and illumination for computer vision
* Embedded system experience is a plus
* Experience from robotic applications is a plus
* Embedded systems experience is a plus
* Ability to communicate in Swedish


**Personal Competences**
* Collaborative mind-set
* Ability to excel in an agile small team environment
* Curiosity and out-of-the-box thinking
* Not afraid of getting hands dirty on a dairy farm from time to time


**We offer you**
 An opportunity to work with vision applications in a creative and dedicated team with end-to-end responsibility.
   

  

 An exciting position at the forefront of technology in a market leading company with customers all over the world.
   

  

 A possibility to work with software development and vision technology in a different and fun area of application, where you solve real world problems and clearly can see the result of your work.
   

  

 The position will be located in Tumba, Stockholm, and reports to Björn Wiklander, Manager Data Science & Vision Technology. The job may occasionally require some travel to test farms, in Sweden and abroad.
   

  

 Welcome with your application (in English)! We will review applications continuously. The last day to apply is December 20.
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.
   

  

 Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group. See more at www.delavalcorporate.com .

title: Google Data Engineer
description:
**Role Description:** 



* Build and migrate existing data solutions to Google Cloud Platform (GCP) to support data analysis and ML/AI products.
* Develop new data products on GCP using DBT and BigQuery.
* Collaborate with Solution Architects and Business Experts to design relevant and efficient data models for data products.
* Integrate and sync data from multiple sources using Cloud Functions and Python, when necessary.
* Orchestrate components and data pipeline elements using Terraform and Cloud Workflows.
* Work closely with other Data Engineers, Data Scientists, and Software Engineers to deliver optimal solutions for current business needs.



  





**Competencies:** 



* Digital: Google Data Engineering



  





**Experience (Years):** 



* 6–8 years



  





**Essential Skills:** 



* Strong hands-on experience with GCP services (BigQuery, Cloud Run, Cloud Functions, Pub/Sub, Cloud Composer, etc.)
* SQL
* DBT
* Python
* Terraform
* Power BI (optional/added advantage)
* CI/CD pipelines
* Minimum 6 years of experience as:
* Data Engineer on modern cloud data platforms or advanced analytics environments,
 **or**
* Software Engineer with cloud technologies and infrastructure
* Experience working with various data formats (Avro, Parquet)
* Proficiency in data query languages (SQL or equivalent)
* Experience with data-centric programming using one or more: Python, Java, Scala
* Strong understanding of data modeling techniques and trade-offs
* Knowledge of NoSQL and RDBMS databases
* Collaborative, co-creative mindset with strong communication skills
* Ability to work independently and make decisions
* Experience with data visualization tools

title: Senior Fullstack Java Developer
description:
Vill du ta din expertis inom fullstackutveckling till nästa nivå? Vi söker en senior utvecklare med lång erfarenhet av Java och moderna frontend-ramverk som vill vara med och bygga framtidens digitala lösningar tillsammans med oss på Accelerate.
   

  

**Varför Accelerate?**
 Vi erbjuder mer än bara ett uppdrag, vi erbjuder en plattform för att växa som expert inom modern mjukvaruutveckling! Hos oss får du inte bara arbeta med spännande teknik och kunder, utan du blir även en del av ett värderingsdrivet, passionerat team där du får stora möjligheter till personlig utveckling och inflytande.
   

  

**Som Konsult Hos Oss Får Du**
* En skräddarsydd utvecklings- och certifieringsplan
* Utmanande och varierande kunduppdrag med den senaste tekniken
* Flexibilitet, frihet och balans mellan jobb och fritid
* En trygg och säker anställning med bra förmåner och kollektivavtal
* Ett sammansvetsat team av vassa specialister som lyfter varandra


 Vi tror på gemenskap och kompetensutbyte – här utvecklas vi tillsammans och stöttar varandra för att alltid ligga i teknisk framkant.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som senior fullstackutvecklare inom Java hos oss är du en nyckelspelare i att utveckla stabila, moderna och skalbara applikationer. Du bidrar med både teknisk erfarenhet och ett agilt mindset i projekt som gör skillnad.
   

  

 Du arbetar både med backendlogik i Java och Spring Boot, och med moderna frontendramverk som React och Angular. Du jobbar nära DevOps och är bekväm med CI/CD, containerisering och molnmiljöer.
   

  

**Exempel på vad du kommer att göra i ditt konsultuppdrag:**
* Utveckla och underhålla mikrotjänstbaserade backendlösningar i Java/Spring Boot
* Skapa intuitiva och responsiva användargränssnitt med React, Angular eller liknande.
* Arbeta med databaser som MySQL och Oracle DB
* Bygga och underhålla CI/CD-pipelines för automatisk testning och leverans
* Arbeta med Docker och Kubernetes för containerhantering och orkestrering
* Delta i arkitektur- och designbeslut samt mentorera juniora kollegor


**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som har minst 8 års erfarenhet som fullstackutvecklare, med djup kompetens inom Java och erfarenhet av moderna webbteknologier. Du är lösningsorienterad, gillar att jobba nära verksamheten och har ett öga för både teknik och användarvärde. Du har en akademisk utbildning med inriktning mot systemutveckling, webbutveckling eller liknande.
   

  

 Du kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift. För denna position krävs svenskt medborgarskap, vi utför även bakgrundskontroll av slutkandidat
   

  

**Vi tror att du har erfarenhet av några av följande:**
* Java, Spring Boot
* TypeScript/JavaScript
* React, Angular eller liknande
* MySQL, Oracle DB
* CI/CD-verktyg
* Docker och Kubernetes


**Extra Plus Om Du Har**
* Erfarenhet av molnlösningar (t.ex. Azure, AWS eller GCP)
* Erfarenhet av testautomatisering och TDD
* Certifieringar inom Java eller molnplattformar
* Erfarenhet av systemarkitektur eller teknisk ledarroll


**Placeringsort**
 Accelerate finns på flertal orter i Sverige och Norge. För denna tjänst utgår du från vårt kontor i Stockholm, med möjlighet till hybridarbete.
   

  

**Vi intervjuar löpande – vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan!**
 Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Har du frågor? Kontakta Jesper Carlsson på jesper.carlsson@iver.se
   

  

**Vi ser fram emot att träffa dig. Välkommen till Accelerate!**

title: Staff Machine Learning Engineer
description:
The Personalization team at Spotify makes deciding what to play next effortless and enjoyable for every listener. We aim to deeply understand music, podcasts, audiobooks, and videos to deliver exceptional recommendations that keep hundreds of millions of people engaged every day. Our work spans across experiences like Home, Search, curated playlists such as Discover Weekly and Daylist, and new innovations like AI DJ and AI Playlists.
   

  

 Search is one of the most important entry points into Spotify’s ecosystem—powering how listeners find and rediscover music, podcasts, and audiobooks. Beyond retrieval, Search drives exploration and discovery, connecting fans with creators in new ways. Building world-class Search means tackling natural language understanding, personalization, and generative AI at massive scale. Generative AI is also revolutionizing Spotify’s product capabilities and technical infrastructure, with generative recommender systems, agent frameworks, and LLMs opening significant opportunities to meet diverse user needs, expand use cases, and gain richer insights into our content and users
   

  

 As a Staff Machine Learning Engineer in Search, you’ll focus on recommender systems modeling at the intersection of generative recommenders and foundational understanding of user taste across music and talk content. You will define and execute the ML technical strategy for Search, building the next generation of Spotify’s recommendation systems, user representations, and supporting technical architecture. Join us and you’ll help millions of users discover and connect with the world’s audio content every day.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Define and drive the ML technical strategy for Search, focusing on retrieval, ranking, and generative approaches
* Build models that improve query understanding, personalization, and relevance across Spotify’s Search experiences
* Collaborate with a cross-functional agile team spanning user research, design, data science, product management, and engineering
* Prototype and productionize new modeling approaches at scale, serving hundreds of millions of users worldwide
* Lead high-impact projects from ideation through deployment, setting best practices for ML development, testing, evaluation, and experimentation
* Partner with tech leaders and stakeholders to influence priorities and ensure long-term scalability and impact
* Stay engaged with the broader ML and Search research community, applying emerging trends to Spotify’s challenges


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have a strong background in machine learning and recommender systems, bridging research and user impact
* You have hands-on experience training and operating transformer models in production, or strong interest in doing so
* You have production experience developing large-scale ML systems in Java, Scala, Python, or similar languages. Experience with PyTorch or TensorFlow is a strong plus
* You are comfortable navigating ambiguity and leading high-impact projects from start to finish
* You’re a systems thinker and strong communicator who can align and influence technical and product stakeholders
* You care deeply about agile processes, data-driven development, and reliability
* You’re eager to apply emerging ML trends, particularly in LLMs and generative recommenders, to Spotify’s challenges


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! For this role, you can be within the European region as long as we have a work location.
* This team operates within the GMT/CET time zone for collaboration.
* Excluding France due to on-call restrictions.


 We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.
   

  

 Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Application Security Engineer
description:
***hackajob** 
 is collaborating with
 **Board Intelligence** 
 to connect them with exceptional tech professionals for this role.*
 Board Intelligence is a technology and advisory firm that supercharges boards with the science of board effectiveness. We build better businesses and benefit society.
   

  

 Through a suite of AI-powered software tools, evaluation frameworks, and advisory services that distil twenty years of boardroom experience, we improve the efficiency of board processes and the effectiveness of boards.
   

  

 We work with over 70,000 leaders and 3,000 organisations across the world, with clients across the Fortune 500, FTSE 100, and OMX 30. In 2024 we received substantial backing from K1 Investment Management - the leading B2B Enterprise SaaS investors. We are at the beginning of significant growth, and we’re looking for superb talent to join us on this journey.
   

  

 As we grow, we’re fiercely protective of our culture and values. Many of us, including our founders, have families and other priorities, so we know the value of a supportive company.
   

  

 The team is diverse and friendly. We value fun: most days you’ll find a social event or learning opportunity to get involved with, including company socials, away days, philanthropic activities and lunch & learns.
   

  

**Our Mission**
 We unleash the potential of organisations through the science of board effectiveness, building better businesses and benefiting society.
   

  

**Our Engineering Team**
 Our Engineering team builds, maintains, and improve the software that our clients rely on. Our work ensures that Board Intelligence product suite is efficient, scalable, and capable of adapting to changing customer needs.
   

  

 This role is an on-site position based in our Central Stockholm office.
   

  

**The Role**
 We are seeking a Security Engineer (Full-Stack) to help build and secure our SaaS solution. In this role, you will work closely with our development teams to embed security best practices into our full-stack applications, which leverage Java, Ruby, React, and other technologies. You will take a proactive approach to measuring/identifying vulnerabilities, designing secure architectures, and implementing security controls across the stack.
   

  

**What will you be responsible for?**
* Secure full-stack applications written in Java (backend), Ruby (backend), and React (frontend)
* Implement and enforce secure coding practices in web applications and APIs
* Conduct threat modeling, code reviews, and security assessments
* Identify and remediate vulnerabilities in our SaaS infrastructure
* Develop security automation for detection and response mechanisms
* Collaborate with engineering, QA, and compliance teams to ensure security requirements are met
* Stay updated on emerging security threats and ensure compliance with security best practices (e.g., OWASP)


**Requirements**
 We’re looking for someone that has a hunger to change our working environment for the better, driving performance from our people and protecting our culture and values to make sure we remain a caring, entrepreneurial and client-first workplace.
   

  

**Role**
 We’re open-minded on the background someone may have coming into this role, but things that could help a candidate to be successful would be:
   

  

* Strong experience in application security
* Strong experience with securing web applications/APIs
* Familiarity with authentication/authorization mechanisms (OAuth, SAML, JWT)
* Proficiency in penetration testing, vulnerability scanning, and security tools
* Strong problem-solving and communication skills
* Experience working/testing in a SaaS-based, high-scale environment
* Contributions to open-source security projects or relevant certifications (e.g., CISSP, OSCP, CEH) is a plus


**Benefits**
 We pride ourselves on our great working environment and package. Here’s some of what’s on offer:
   

  

* 25 days of Vacation with Advanced Vacation days
* Wellness benefits including a wellness hour per week for exercise and up to SEK 2,000 per year for wellness activities
* Parental leave with 90% salary coverage for up to 6 months
* Comprehensive insurance including Group Life, TFA Safety and Travel
* Regular team lunches and fikas
* ITP1 + Flexpension
* Vision benefit with free eye test & terminal glasses
* Tax-free daily allowances for travel
* Activities such as conferences, kick-offs, and other events

title: Senior Fullstack .NET-utvecklare
description:
As of 2 September 2025, Vivicta, former Tietoevry Tech Services, now operates as a standalone company under our new brand. We’ve officially launched Vivicta, your trusted Nordic transformation partner, making everyday easier through technology. You can explore more about our brand and what we stand for at https://www.vivicta.com
   

  

 Ready to join us? Click ‘Apply’ and complete our short application form to get started. Prefer another option? Apply via LinkedIn to automatically populate your details using your profile.
   

  

 Vill du vara med och skapa framtidens digitala lösningar? Vi på Vivicta söker nu en erfaren och driven Senior Fullstack .NET-utvecklare som brinner för att kombinera tekniskt djup med affärsförståelse. Hos oss får du möjlighet att ta ett helhetsansvar i spännande kundprojekt, arbeta nära arkitekter och utvecklare, och bidra med din kompetens för att skapa innovativa lösningar som gör skillnad.
   

  

**När du börjar på Vivicta som Senior Fullstack .NET-utvecklare kommer du**
* Arbeta med att vidareutveckla och förvalta våra kunders digitala lösningar
* Tillsammans med våra arkitekter ta ett tekniskt ägandeskap över våra kundprojekt
* Coacha och leda våra utvecklare
* Estimera och presentera lösningsförslag för våra kunder
* Vara kontaktyta för våra kunder och svara på projektrelaterade frågor


**Vem vi söker**
* Du har minst 5 års erfarenhet av .NET MVC/Core samt goda kunskaper av MS SQL, Rest APIer och Oauth
* Goda kunskaper om mikroarkitektur
* Du har arbetat i agila projekt och organisationer
* Flytande språkkunskaper i svenska och engelska, tal och skrift


**Det är meriterande om du också har**
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med React
* Erfarenhet av Azure DevOps
* Erfarenhet av SharePoint-utveckling
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med CMS
* Erfarenhet av E-commerce
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta som konsult


**Vi erbjuder** 
**dig**
 Vi erbjuder dig professionell tillväxt, meningsfulla projekt, öppen kultur och en enastående balans mellan arbete och privatliv! Vi erbjuder dig en möjlighet att skapa framtiden för en snabbt växande och viktig sektor. Vi tror att vår organisationskultur är en viktig del för att du ska bli framgångsrik. Vi tillhandahåller en flexibel hybrid arbetsmodell som en del av vår kultur och vårt sätt att arbeta. Slutligen tror vi också på nyfikenhet och konstant lärande som en livsstil där du behöver skola om dig varje dag när nya möjligheter dyker upp.
   

  

**Blev du inspirerad?**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Bifoga ditt CV eller LinkedIn-profil så kontaktar vi dig. Intervjuer kommer att hållas löpande, så vi uppmanar dig att söka redan idag. Om du har några frågor angående denna roll, vänligen kontakta anställande chef, Johan Rydberg, johan.rydberg@tietoevry.com
   

  

 Hoppas vi hörs snart!
   

  

*Vi utför bakgrundskontroller av alla slutkandidater.*
*Vivicta värdesätter mångfald och välkomnar ansökningar från personer oavsett kön, ålder, funktionsvariation, etnicitet, sexuell läggning, religion, övertygelse eller bakgrund.*
*Vivicta avvisar samtal från rekryteringsföretag.*

title: Senior ML Engineer
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**
 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, while building trust across the world. With our roots in Sweden and a global reach, we deliver smart services that create meaningful social impact. We are committed to protecting you from fraud, harassment, scam calls, and unwanted messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
   

  

* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and the world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 450 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv, with high ambitions.


**We at the Search Team** 
 are responsible for Spam Detection, AI Identity, Name Resolution, and Fraud Detection. By accurately assigning names to phone numbers, detecting spam and fraud, and providing contextual caller information, we enhance users' trust and safety, empowering them to make informed decisions about incoming calls and directly supporting Truecaller’s mission of enabling safe and trusted communication.
   

  

**As a Senior ML Engineer,** 
 you will be working hands-on to optimise training and deployment of ML models to be quick and cost-efficient. You will also be at the forefront of putting our ML models on mobile devices to enhance data privacy and customer experience. To achieve this, you will need to collaborate with teams across Truecaller to establish best practices and tools for efficient ML model development and deployment, particularly on mobile platforms. You will be expected to help Truecaller reach and stay at the cutting edge of ML training and deployment, as well as explore new frontiers such as federated learning.
   

  

**The Impact You Will Create**
* Understand the current and future needs of developers and the organisation, and create a roadmap with your manager for meeting those needs.
* Work with teams throughout Truecaller, enabling them to put models into production quickly and cost-effectively.
* Work hands-on with teams throughout Truecaller to optimise ML models for mobile devices.
* Be the go-to expert for developing models for mobile devices as well as deploying them.
* Staying up to date with the latest trends and technologies in ML Engineering, especially ML on mobile phones, and driving continuous innovation throughout Truecaller.


**What You Bring In**
* Degree in computer science or equivalent
* 5+ years of experience in machine learning engineering, with a focus on deploying ML models in production environments.
* A strong understanding and experience to optimise feature engineering, model training, and model deployment.
* Hands-on experience deploying ML models on mobile devices (e.g., TensorFlow Lite, Core ML, ONNX Runtime Mobile).
* Strong understanding of machine learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, ONNX) and their deployment on mobile platforms.
* Understanding of both Android and iOS development and how that impacts ML model deployment and usage.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively across different teams and disciplines.
* A customer-focused mindset.
* Excellent communication skills in spoken and written English.


**Life At Truecaller - Behind The Code**
**https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/**
**Sounds like your dream job?**
 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
   

  

**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.**
 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget range.
* Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then, check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!


**Come As You Are**
 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.
   

  

 Job info
   

  

 Location
   

  

**Stockholm, Sverige**
 Category
   

  

**Data Science**
 Team
   

  

**Search**
 Posted
   

  

**today**

title: Senior Solutions Engineer
description:
**About NetApp**
 NetApp is the intelligent data infrastructure company, turning a world of disruption into opportunity for every customer. No matter the data type, workload or environment, we help our customers identify and realize new business possibilities. And it all starts with our people.
   

  

 If this sounds like something you want to be part of, NetApp is the place for you. You can help bring new ideas to life, approaching each challenge with fresh eyes. Of course, you won't be doing it alone. At NetApp, we're all about asking for help when we need it, collaborating with others, and partnering across the organization - and beyond.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 As a Senior Solutions Engineer, you determine customer needs for solutions and services from NetApp. You analyze customer requirements and convert them into technical solution concepts. You can present NetApp technologies to customers at different levels of responsibility, adapt to the interlocutors and question their motives and motivational factors. You not only support sales in the first technical customer discussions but are also responsible for the technical elaboration of the solutions offered.
   

  

 Job Requirements
   

  

 Your area of responsibility includes the technical representation of NetApp and in particular the analysis of existing cloud, IT, network, application, backup and storage landscapes at customers. In the role of a Trusted Advisor, you are responsible for developing solution concepts and architectures, which you will present to a larger audience as part of a technical customer presentation. Active contact with customers in cooperation with the responsible Client Executive and ensuring that technically complex inquiries are handled competently and implemented professionally are the focus of this task.
   

  

 Education
   

  

 Are you enthusiastic about innovative technology and would you like to constantly develop yourself?
   

  

 Do you find it easy to explain complex issues and do you find yourself in the following points?
   

  

* Interest in current trends in IT and technologies used (e.g. public clouds, hybrid clouds, container technologies, DevOps concepts, artificial intelligence)
* High motivation to actively advise our customers on their path to digital transformation and to develop joint solutions
* You can think analytically, are creative and team-oriented
* You like to bring different people together and work towards a common goal
* IT knowledge, including in enterprise/cloud computing, virtualization, storage, backup or high availability solutions
* Knowledge of storage technologies is desirable
* Successfully completed technical training or technical studies with appropriate professional experience
* Very good knowledge of Swedish and English Language


 At NetApp, we embrace a hybrid working environment designed to strengthen connection, collaboration, and culture for all employees. This means that most roles will have some level of in-office and/or in-person expectations, which will be shared during the recruitment process.
   

  

 At NetApp, we embrace a hybrid working environment designed to strengthen connection, collaboration, and culture for all employees. This means that most roles will have some level of in-office and/or in-person expectations, which will be shared during the recruitment process.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer:**
 NetApp is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all laws that prohibit employment discrimination based on age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, disability or genetic information, pregnancy, and any protected classification.
   

  

**Why NetApp?**
 We are all about helping customers turn challenges into business opportunity. It starts with bringing new thinking to age-old problems, like how to use data most effectively to run better - but also to innovate. We tailor our approach to the customer's unique needs with a combination of fresh thinking and proven approaches.
   

  

 We enable a healthy work-life balance. Our volunteer time off program is best in class, offering employees 40 hours of paid time per year to volunteer with their favourite organizations. We provide comprehensive medical, dental, wellness, and vision plans for you and your family. We offer educational assistance, legal services, and access to discounts. Finally, we provide financial savings programs to help you plan for your future.
   

  

 If you want to help us build knowledge and solve big problems, let's talk.
